She was just passing by not even supposed to be assigned to our table. She was great made awesome recommendations. My baja fish tacos tasted great. And it was the perfect amount. Thanks Try'esha for saving the night.

My girlfriends and I wanted to stop for some lunch on the strip during our early afternoon walk and this place caught our eye.  Bottom line: HUGE disappointment!  Here's what we ordered: 
Fundido de quest con chorizo: it did not taste good at all.  You couldn't really taste the chorizo despite seeing it in there.  It tasted like curdled/cheap cheese. 
Carne asada tacos: I took 2 bites and gave up.  The saltiest carne asada and it tasted like someone scraped it off the pans from last night. 
2xTortilla Soup: the chicken was dry.  It was more of a thicker broth.  
The waiter was great and he took the carne asada off the bill.  
Don't waste your money.

This was really nice Mexican. 

The staff could have shown a bit more enthusiasm; and their attentiveness was so so. 

Meanwhile, the food was good, and it came out at a reasonable speed. They refilled the corn chips and dip, and that was delicious. We had the nacho platter to share as well, and it did not disappoint. The guac was amazing!

I had the cotija cheese crusted quesadilla, the appetiser, as a main, and thought it was enough after consuming a bit of the corn chips. 

One friend had the tortilla soup, and said it was packed with flavour!

The other friend has sammy's tequila shrimp. She was really happy with them. She said they were tasted fantastic, and was plenty food. 

Overall, not a bad place for really good food!

this was actually really good....some of the best food I had in Vegas this entire trip. It was a tad pricey for alcohol, $11 for sangria (although, it was a pint)....and $15 for a salad with no meat (I assumed they would knock a couple bucks off for not wanting the meat). So the entire thing with tax and tip was $34. So i was a tad shocked.

But...the service was fantastic. Super nice and helpful. And the salad was amazing. Tortialla shells on the bottom, with guacamole, lettuce, onion, tomato, avocado and beans.  Delish. Definitely could have used more beans, however. 

Overall it was a good experience, but like everything in Vegas...a tad pricey.

The Margarita with Grand Marnier was to die for, and the service was great. But don't count on good food. Chips and salsa (not free) were subpar and the tacos were flavorless. The pinto beans were acceptable at best. Don't waste your money here---this place needs to revamp its menu.
Wait staff apathetic, food ok nothing awesome or original. Less than 2 ounces chicken in dinner sized salad with chicken addd

I just returned from a 3 night stay in Las Vegas. On our first night we wanted to go somewhere fun that was close (We stayed at the Elara Hilton). We were directed to Cabo Wabo. We ended up ordering nachos. We gave them crazy requests to make my teenage daughters and me happy. We ended up with beans and jalapeños on the side with chicken on half. They were happy to do this for us. They even brought out more chips and condiments for a low price for us. We went back for the same thing on our last night. And the price was relatively good. A big thumbs us from us.
Had the carne asada nachos 4 dollars more for carne and it had very little of it. Not recommended to pay 18.95 for it. Good server though.

I have to give it 5 stars, even though the drinks are grossly overpriced.  The food is just amazing.  Cheese dip, fantastic.  Chicken quesadillas, best I've ever had.  The fried rice is outstanding.  My husband always gets the sirloin fajitas and they actually cook them medium unlike most places who cook them well.  Love the food.  Service has always been great as well.  They do have a really good happy hour with food/drinks though.

We went here for our anniversary, the drinks are great , but I ordered the shrimp and I got food poisoning ......not a good way to spend my anny. It is loud inside, service is slow and it is pricing for the food.

I stopped here for breakfast while I was In Las Vegas. I had the Machaca omelet it comes with shredded Mexican beef chorizo peppers and onions Oaxacan cheese sour cream and pico de gallo. It was absolutely delicious and filled me up nicely. A couple of people were sitting on either side of me and they commented on how good it both looked and smelled and one of them ordered it. 
The service was good my bartender was really nice although I can't remember her name unfortunately. 
I definitely recommend going here.

Had this place for lunch yesterday and to be honest it wasn't much to write home about. Service wasn't bad but the waiter kept messing up our order and then tried to charge us an extra  $50 on our ticket. Would I come back here again, nope. The food was average and tasted more like Chili's and was too pricey for the quality of food even by Las Vegas standards. I honestly wouldn't even recommend this place as a top 50 choice of restaurants in Las Vegas. And their margaritas were not even very strong, they weren't nasty but again they are Chili's quality. In my opinion I'd pass on this place unless everywhere else was packed.

The food here is decent considering it's on the Strip.  That's about the best I can say. The drinks however were disappointing.  I tried several different mixed drinks and they were never quite right.  On top of that, expensive for what you get.

Good view from the balcony though.

I usually give companys a break but i truly think this company needs great improvement,  the service as far as how long it took to get a burger was very poor it took 25 to 35 minutes  after the initial 15 minutes it took just to get our server to the table to receive our food the food was ok but not really very good, my friends said they had Mexican food and it was definitely better it hot on the patio no misters .
The waitress was a real b*tch, really rude I'm surprised she still works there. Never going back.

We went to this place only for appetizers before the show. We were able to be immediately seated since we chose to sit inside. The waitress seemed very knowledgeable and very attentive. 

The salsa was overly salty but was balanced by the bland chips. I was impressed by the nachos they were very tasty and I enjoyed the guacomole, don't using like it.  I would attend again if I return to Vegas.

We stopped here for a quick drink inside the Miracle mall while waiting for the Marc Savard comedy show.  We sat down, spoke to the bartender for a bit, and ordered Waboritas, very good btw.

However, yet another camera lady came and took a picture of us.  When I told her I did not want to buy the picture, she stormed away with a pretty bad attitude....

Dear Cabo Wabo / Planet Hollywood, please do not allow rude photographers ruin the experience of your guests.  

Cheers
Extremely satisfied by my service by Jason. He did a fantastic job making sure we felt welcome and appreciated as guests which is hard to find in Vegas. Also the guacamole was really yummy.

We stopped in here before a show and were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food. My wife and friend had the lime cilantro chicken breast. The portion was large and the accompanying vegetables were fresh and delicious. The berry mojito and Sammy's Red beer were both good. Service was pretty good. The calamari appetizer was tasty, but a little too greasy. The fish tacos (3) were large and tasty.

I have been here twice on two separate Vegas trips. So service is what ever but the food is darn good! Ceviche is okay. The best is the chicken quesadilla, it has crispy cheese on the outside it's so amazing! Appetizer is too small. Nachos are also great! Lots of cheese!!! Can't wait to have it all again
Best Place Ever!!! The food was so good.  It was like there was a Party in my mouth!!!! And the drinks were good!!! Excellent service..

Super fast service and our waitress was fun and perky.  The food was tasty, but nothing to write home about.  I'd for sure go back as the atmosphere was fun and exciting, definitely a great way to start of the Vegas vacation!

The food here is pretty. Me whole table thought their meals were good. Nothing to get excited as far as food goes. The atmosphere is the best part of this place. We ate out on the patio. Very fun, loud place. Everyone seems to be having fun. Not a place to come if you want to hold conversations. But very fun for drinking and people watching. Service was ok. We got our food pretty quick but our server never came back to get us more drinks or see if our food was ok. But, in her defense it was very busy at that time. Probly wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but glad I finally got here
Laura provided excellent service.  What an awesome employee for this business.  She was attentive, friendly, upsold me a drink, and invited us back for breakfast.  Impressive.

$3 for chips and salsa - ridiculous! This comes free at a majority of Mexican establishments. 
Overall dinner was sub par, and coupled with loud Hip Hop music, the total effect was v dissapointing.

Aia out beautiful waitress just made our day so much brighter getting my grandmother a shot for Mother's Day and treating us so kindly. 
Thank you Aia (1044) saw that # on the ticket :-) hope it's the right girl

When there on Sunday nite with my wife to have late dinner. I have been here before food is ok service was good but this time service was terrible , we sat there for 20 min no one showed up I got up and asked one of the girls in front for help and that didn't help, finally a waiter showed up to say hello and left as fast as he showed up. I say if they were busy Ok but they weren't. That's the last time I'm going to go there and would not recommended anybody to go there.

I feel like two stars is generous but one star is because my friend and I still had a good time and the other star is because we got the Cadillac Nachos for free with the Miracle Mile coupon book. This place was cute and fun but the food was terrible and the service was slow and nonexistent. Our food was cold, my friend got the wrong drink, and her order was messed up three times (even after sending it back). We won't be coming back here.

I was there Sat for lunch. The food was NO bueno!  my friend had a Bloody Mary, she said it wasnt that good.

I had an enchilada and a taco de carnitas........I might as well have just gone to Taco Bell and saved the money. 

The service was not the best either........... I had to ask one chick/hostess who clearly heard me the first time ....... where the restroom was at.

I would never go back to this place.

Yes, the outside seating patio is nice but thats about it for this place.

Soooooooooo disappointed!!!! It's like being at a cattle drive and you're the cattle.... The food was decent, atmosphere was ok but, the service is absolutely atrocious!! They seat you and tell you to be patient because they just over seated that section. Ok, I'm patient, I'm in the business... I'm not that patient!! We waited and waited and waited, finally drinks and our order taken. Then we waited and waited and waited. Food comes, I wait and wait and wait for salsa. Ask for desert menu, wait and wait and wait. I'm sure you get it by now. They need  a new cattle hand to whip this place into shape...

Loved their chips and salsa. So kudos LOTS for the best chips on the strip. Service is excellent and our server was awesome. I ordered the carnitas platter, its served with rice, beans, guacamole and hot flour tortillas. Their meat was a little dry but overall it was really flavorful- I added the salsa served with their chips and it gave the carnitas quite a bit of a pop. Would definitely keep coming to this place!

What I imagine to be the worst place to watch the UFC on the strip. We arrived late thanks to a plan delay which should have allowed the staff plenty of time to take care of EVERYONE before as we were the last table to arrive for the reserved seating area. We stepped into the elevator and expressed our frustration with the delay and how much we were ready to eat and drink. Still so much time went past before a waitstaff approached our table  that my husband had to go bar. They didn't have my drink available on the 2nd floor despite it being on the menu so the bartender said he would go downstairs....nope, never happened. Again we waited. We finally got my drink from another staff member and order food...not terrible. The icing on the cake....everyone left their tables and we still didn't receive a bill...we waited til it was completely empty of patrons, still nothing. Time to go in my opinion. Of course they had our card on file from our reservation so of course they got their money, too bad we didn't get what we paid for. Don't go there. Don't be disappointed. Lame place.

Salsa and Chips are HUGE....Great location, great waiter and seating staff and very good food.  I am not Mexican but I eat Mexican food almost every week.  The food was very good, cost effective, and the location is right in the middle of everything. Stop here and get a drink and an appetizer.  We did this the night before I left but we should have went here sooner......

Food was amazing but carefull they force you to tip them. The server told us the tip is required and we HAVE to pay it and according to her, her manager told her it's mandatory even when the receipt shows it's suggested. Horrible rip off. I will never go there again. We were going to tip her but she told us $30 is additional tip required. Never again
Only had the happy hour tequila and a carne asana street taco! Both were yummy total 9 bucks!

LOVE this place. Decent service, AMAZING drinks, and great location. Can view bellagio fountain show while on patio, and the food is AMAZING. the Sopas con Carne is the best food i've ever eaten. Their fajitas are pretty amazing as well, and their abondigas soup is perfection. Don't forget to try the dreamsicle! it's amazing
Good food, large portion!  Not a big fan of the salsa. Great view & people watching if you sit outside.

Always a great place to hang out and people watch ... grab a seat on the rail overlooking Las Vegas Blvd and drink the afternoon away. Great margaritas, solid chips and salsa, decent entrees ... the chicken sabana with beans and chorizo is excellent!

Excellent Service and good food! We enjoy coming here and will always return. Our waiter,  Jason is really nice and professional. The manager, Summer is awesome as well!  If you want to have an enjoyable experience,  come hang out at Cano Wabo!!

This place was very busy on a Saturday afternoon. The service was pretty slow. However, the salsa was great! We ordered a pitcher of Margaritas for the three of us. It went for about 4 Margaritas total. Food was good. I would eat there again.

Delicious food, great views of the strip. We did the yelp check-in deal and got ourselves a delicious (strong) margarita. I enjoyed dinner and would definitely look forward to going again, especially with the reasonable prices and good chips/salsa.

I harshed this place in my last review of it, deservedly in my opinion. 

I gave Cabo Wabo another chance on a recent trip.  My buddy and I wanted to chill and have a couple drinks, so we gave it another try for drinks and appetizers. 

We asked to sit on the outdoor deck overlooking the strip, and it was all good this time.  Our server was very attentive and fun.  The margaritas were good.  The chips and salsa were good.  The "Mexiyaki" chicken wings were great.  We had a great time and ended up having "more than couple" margaritas along the way.   

Pricing seemed fine for drinks and appetizers in Vegas.  I think the tab with tax for chips and salsa, chicken wings, and about 8 margaritas was about $100.00  

All in all, I'd say Cabo Wabo is great for drinks and appetizers if you want casual and if you want to sit outside.  They have indoor seating, but I can't speak to that.  For me at least, one the main draws is the outdoor deck overlooking the strip.

I've been to cabo Wabo a couple of times, sat outside and it was great.  Had the fajitas and a margarita and both were very tasty.  They had a great band for entertainment and it was a lot of fun.  Definitely will go back again and again.

Cocorita! Coconut margaritas are yummy. We ordered chicken enchiladas, lobster enchiladas, shrimp ceviche, steak burrito, and steak fajitas. They were all delicious. Everyone enjoyed their meals. Pricing $16 - $22 each, which is normal for most LV strip restaurants. The lobster was very sweet.

Blah. It was okay. I think if they lowered all of the prices by five dollars and added a couple of waitresses, I would have had an A+ experience. It was a huge tourist trap. Would probably not go back.

Seeing as how I was staying at PH it was only right I came here. Granted I didn't dine here, but I sure did use the walk up bar to get some yummy drinks. I got a mix, of what I really dont remember because I drank so much out there, lol, but it was strawberry and reg margaritas i think mixed in the tall 12 dollar glass. With an extra shot of course. Yes. I know. 12 bucks. for a drink. + a few more bucks for a shot. How stupid, right? Wrong. I'm an out of towner, typical tourist, taking in the sights and Cabo Wabo was actually one of my fav places to drink on the strip. Prob because of the convenience of coming downstairs in the middle of the night getting an alcoholic beverage. Either way, by the time my week long vegas trip was over I brought home about a good 4 Cabo Wabo cups. Looking forward to doing it all over again when I come back in October. I'll give a better review then since my Vegas cherry has been popped.

This place has a great vibe and a great place to come if you're looking for some good eats on the strip. A great, relaxed place for a group. The beef short rib burrito is baaamb. Drinks are good too. You really can't go wrong, the price is eh but all in all a good place whilst on vacation or need a quick place to eat.

Service was very slow! We had to wait about an hour til we get our food. We didnt order appetizers because we thought our orders were simple enough. I ordered fish and chips (it's on the specialties list) and the fish was overcooked. 
Hubs ordered fish tacos. 

Host was lovely. Waitress not so much. If you are hungry or pressed for time, do not come here!!
good food and they were really busy it took a lot longer for drinks and food to get there but over all the place is good

OK so the drinks were good... Strong and tasty, a bit pricey, and the waitress was friendly. Why two stars? Because we were going by we saw a sign they'd be showing the fights and decided to stop there for dinner and drinks. We asked about the fights and they said $30/person to go inside upstairs and watch or watch at the bar for free. Well, we said we'd sit at the bar. After inquiring twice about when they'd be showing the fights we were informed that they actually weren't showing the fights at the bar and welcomed us to open our wallet to go upstairs. Felt totally conned. We cancelled our order, got to go cups and left with our drinks. Do not appreciate being lied to.

Good food, live music, good margaritas. Got the chicken Quesadillas and my friend had the fajitas. Both were delicious and the rice and beans were good as well. No free chips and salsa like many Mexican places but I guess that's expected along the strip.
Best drinks on the strip in my opinion. Prices are reasonable and it has a fun atmosphere looking over the strip

Bomb chips and salsa.

Great seating outside - something rare in Vegas. 

Large glasses of water and soda - also a bonus. Service was great.

Prices were high, portions small. Tacos were like BABY tacos. But again, it's Vegas, so prepared to get ripped off.

This place rocks!! Ryan was our waiter & he is awesome! Super nice & fun. This place is amazing. We sat immediately & put food was here so fast it was crazy. It was soooo good. I had the salad & the lettuce was shredded so fine that it was seriously the easiest salad to eat... I know that sounds weird but if you eat salad a lot you know what I mean. 

Anyway, awesome place & food rocks & chips are made right here & super hot :)
Thanks!

Great food, great drinks, great service.  Went there on 01/18/2016 for my birthday.  We were out looking for food and decided to see if Cabo Wabo had any.  They do. It's was great and the waiter certainly is an asset to the company.  Highly recommend!!
At first I didn't like the place nor how the menu looked but once the food came I was  blown away by taste

The atmosphere was welcoming, as we were visiting from Out of town. The waiter seemed annoyed, and the first impression was the salsa wasn't good AT ALL. Being a Mexican restaurant and not having good salsa, is huge!! Ordered a quesadilla, and had to send it back because it had no flavor, or taste. Enjoyed the live music though....

Horrible margaritas. Cabo Wabo is not a good tequila, IMHO.

Service was OK, food was below average for a Mexican chain. I won't return.

we were wanting mexican and decided this based on location. food was ok: margaritas- pretty good, not very strong; chips were very thick, salsa was spicy and fresh; beef fajitas- beef was charred like it like it (though they didnt ask how we would like our steak cooked); tortillas were not homemade- looked like they were right out of a plastic package and werent even warm. if a restaurant uses premade tortillas, warming them would be a good idea. service, however, was very good. we really didnt have any expectations of the place, so there was little room to be disappointed. we were seated on the patio and had a great view of the bellagio fountains, and there were misters all over the patio, which was a nice respite from the heat. overall, it was ok, and we woiuld go again, if only to have a drink and watch the fountain show!

This place is awesome! Located in LV so you could imagine how busy it must be. Regardless of the amount of people that decided to eat there at the same time we did, which was a lot, the service couldn't have been any better/faster! Our server was attentive at all times and super upbeat! 

The food was very tasteful and so were the drinks. I got the carne asada torta and a house margarita. I definitely recommend both! The torta was delicious and so filling that I was only able to eat half of it. I put half of the blame on the fries, which were also super good. 

Prices were pretty reasonable, specially compared to nearby spots taking into consideration that it's a tourist area.  All in all, definitely five star worthy!

This place is good for two things:

1. Margarita headaches
2. People watching (exceptionally good for this)

Ok, this is Vegas; but this place was pretty terrible as far as the food went. I don't think thats why anyone would go here... but still. Skip it.

The margaritas are, meh... sugary and headache-making.

Anyway, good location, you can see the Bellagio water show go off every half-hour, but aside from that and watching all the weirdoes walk by, no redeeming qualities. Save yourself the $50.

There was a Michael Jackson impersonator just standing on the sidewalk and not dancing though...

Skip it
Stopped in for a margarita and nibble before our show.  The queso fondue was tasty.  Great patio for people watching on the strip.

If i could rate Cabo Wabo a negative score I would. 

We arrive just in time for Karaoke, which I would give 5 Stars.  But that's where the good ends. 

We were not actually sat by the hostess just pointed toward the tables. No menus, so I'm assuming the frat boy waiter assumed we didn't want service. When I asked for menus he looked at me like I was nuts. Then 5 seconds after getting the menus he asked us, "so are you gonna order something?" Really?

He never asked us if wanted drinks, I went up to the Bar to get mine. For a weak 8 oz margarita it was TWENTY DOLLARS!!!! For a pre-made Slurpee with house alcohol!!   

I would never go back there again. They treated us like trash and we did nothing to deserve it. 

And to top it off I accidentally left an expensive souvenir behind, when I returned they didn't have a lost n found they said "we just throw it away". I tried to express the whole experience to the manager, his response was "oh well". 

WOW - worst service EVER!
We only got drinks but the Vegas crush and the three way too notch! Perfect for a sunny day just walking on the strip!

I really didn't want to like this place.  I guess it was an anti white-guy-owning-tequila-company thing.  BUT it's pretty good and good on him I guess. Wife and I stopped in to get a quick bite/drink before seeing a show. We shared the queso dip and chips, dos ceviches, and mexican tossed salad. Queso dip - ok. Dos ceviches - amazing. Some shrimp ceviche and some chipotle tuna tartar. It was REALLY good. Like enough to tell people about and "go back for" good. The salad - surprisingly good. Very simply dressed, cilantro and corn included. Very good. Overall, pretty good. Even better if you can get a seat out on the patio for some people watching.

My friend & I came here for our anniversary on 9/23/17. We asked for Chips and Salsa as appetizer. That was good! We also asked for a Pitcher of Margarita (Verde, Cilantro, Cucumber) once brought out our glasses were warm, no salt on rim and no lime wedge to emphasize the drink looks. Out pitcher has TONS of ice more than half the pitcher was ice. The it was tasty but  we had trouble tasting the tequila! Price $47+TAX. Our entrees were Pulled Pork Platter: Excess fat on meat, little meat, NO pico de Gallo, No corn tortillas only flour, Beans were runny and no black beans. She order Nachos (no meat she is vegetarian) She found some meat in her nachos and she was gross out and didn't eat. We asked for limes and took about 7 minutes to bring 3 wedges. We asked for the bill and came out to be $99.00 with a $20 cash tip. We had a terrible time here. We enjoyed our company but the food, drinks and customer service was very disappointing. We didn't enjoy our lunch at all so we paid and left. I hope management reached out to me and we can discuss more about this matter. I don't recommend this spot to anyone celebrating their anniversary or a special day. Its bad service and overpriced. Not worth what you pay. I don't recommend Cabo Wabo to anyone out there. How can we had enjoyed our lunch there? No way! We don't seek perfection but we do seek good hospitality.

This is the first time I have gone to this place in the whole country, so I had a blast here. Even though, I didn't order food, we got DRINKS quite a few of them. We were group of 6 guys, everyone else got food and they could hardly finish their meals. The service here was FANTASTIC, super friendly staff. 

So, it was one of my friend's b'day, so I asked the server if we could get him a piece of cake/ dessert on the house . He said NO!    *At this point, I am like shitt*

The very next second, he says, I can do TEQUILA shots. I was thinking maybe it's for him only, but server got it for entire table.

Tip: You can get a house margherita if you do a YELP Check-IN.

We stopped in here on our first night in town. It was the only place I could sway the whole group to go into - we got a bucket of beers and stood out on the uncomfortably packed deck for no reason. We should have moved on. The live music was not that great, and I was in no mood for the crowd. I'll probably avoid this place next time I'm in town.

Aia was the best! Came two days in a row for the amazing nachos and the wonderful service. Always a must when in VEGAS! Thank you aia for being so friendly and sweet to my baby girl. We Will always be back!

We were a party of 6. We went there for dinner . We ordered a few appetizers and drinks. 
The food included a platter of appetizers and one nachos (cheese with peppers etc - it was a vegetarian dish) .  Honestly we wanted to order main course after but we were super full. 
It is a decent restaurant , prices are okay. Not that high. 
But the drinks were bad. We ordered shots , of course tequila shots. Everyone had 2 shots but there was no feel . It felt like it was diluted. Sorry but that is exactly what we felt. 
Then ordered margarita. And it was also like 5.5/10.
I was expecting more :( 
Sorry about that.

I like Cabo Wabo because they serve a complete collection of tequilas. The downside is that the place is so expensive ($15 for a margarita)... and chips and salsa was not complementary.Guess the location is responsible for a portion of the fees?

This is such a fun establishment! My husband and I sat outside and were entertained the entire time just by people watching and the fun music. The food is delicious! We were able to sit immediately which was super convenient! We'll be back once in Vegas again!

Fun place!  Hostess attitude is a problem as usual...they really have no power but think they do...lol
 Excellent selection of Tequila...prob best in Vegas!
Outside patio is on strip!!!  Inside very nice but tables a little close..   Cleaner than original in Cabo!
Sammy plays here on occasion.

Our favorite Mexican food in Vegas. Everything is fresh and delicious. The place is always packed, but the service is always top notch. We try to visit Cabo Wabo everytime we go to Vegas. Great queso, quacamole. I try to order combo plates so I can try all kinds of dishes. I've never been disappointed.

My friend and I rolled into LV late and were looking for a lively place to grab some food and drinks. I had high hopes for Cabo Wabo after several good experiences at Margaritaville. Thought this place would have a similar vibe and offer quality food. Not quite....I'll be heading to Margaritaville in the future. 

We sat on the patio...misters were nice in the 100+ temps. Waitress was nice...raucous, horrible sound from the karaoke bar was not so nice. 

The fish tacos were bland , runny and the tortillas were on the brink of expiration. They just had zero flavor. My friend said her tacos were so-so. Didn't bother ordering drinks for I knew it was going to be a quick dinner. 

I would have been better off at Del Taco (at least I would have pocketed some money to take to Sephora to buy some makeup or thrown the $50 in the slot machines). 

Will not be returning.

Oddly enough, I'd never been to a Cabo Wabo before just recently. I honestly don't know why, because the food was delicious and the atmosphere was lively.

The wait staff was extremely helpful and exuberant. Our waitress was attentive and kind, even when we had to wait on a late member of our party. She continually checked if we needed anything and gave us great recommendations for the food. We were really pleased with the service, especially since it was a packed restaurant on the Vegas strip.

I ordered the "Three Way" (I know, it sounds terrible) as my beverage of choice. It was one of those icy, mixed cocktails from the slurpee-looking machines in the front of the establishment. And let me tell you, it was far from terrible. In fact, if the alcohol didn't pack such a punch, I might have ordered two. The drink is a mixture of raspberry, blueberry, and blackberry flavoring. It was light, fruity, and very refreshing on a Vegas summer night. 

For my meal, I ordered the Chicken Enchilada Combo, which includes rice and beans. And if you just look at the picture I've supplied, you can already tell that it was amazing. I loved the verde sauce on top of the enchiladas themselves. The chicken was succulent and full of flavor. The rice had a good amount of spice and the beans were fresh. The cheese was also yummy; thoroughly melted and mixed. 

We also had several servings of chips and salsa before our meal. The fact that we kept asking for another heaping has more to do with the fact that the chips and salsa were both crisp and fresh, rather than because we were starving. 

Finally, the food is heavy. In other words, be prepared to pack a to-go box. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at Cabo Wabo. And I look forward to my next visit.

Happy feasting!

Had lunch here. It has a great location, mid strip right outside Planet Hollywood. I had the shredded beef tacos & the sangarita. The drink was awesome, a mix of a sangria & a margarita. I got it in the big souvenir cup, which is a large glass cup with cabo wabo Las Vegas on it. The tacos were also really good. 2 large tacos in a crispy she'll with plenty of juicy meat & fresh toppings. I got extra salsa, I suggest doing that because it doesn't come with much on it. The service was really good & fast. They were very polite & new the menu very well. I would come back here.
Excellent service, good food and outdoor seating where you can watch the bellagio fountains.  Band was excellent too!

Cabo wabo deserves more stars! The patio is such a fun place to people watch and sip on margaritas! The food and service was really great too and a decent price for Las Vegas. The chefs lobster burrito special was on point and you can't go wrong with the fajitas! Also they have killer margaritas. The seating for the patio can get a bit crowded. But overall, I'd recommend grabbing a bite here if you're craving some tex-mex and checking out Bellagio fountains while you're in the area.

Horrible Horrible place. The service is ridiculous! The host was the extremely rude and made it seem as we were bothering her with our presence.  It seemed as if they didnt want you to come in so she can text on her phone and chat amoungst themselves.  For the great service is Las Vegas im sure this place can do better then need to re hire a whole new staff and start fresh.  Even the security guard was disrespectful! When I tried to walk by him to squeeze through he wouldent move and inch after asking.  Overall this place stinks and you can choose a way better place. DONT GO TO CABO WABO!!!!
The food is okay if you're hungry. But it's kind of pricey considering what you're getting. I'm guessing the cost is attributed to the location.

Fun atmosphere sitting along the strip. Reasonable prices on most things. They prepared the portabello fajitas for me vegan and gluten free. It was pretty oily though! The strawberry lemonade is delicious and if you buy a glass they refill it for free...forever! The waiter was super friendly and helpful and really on top of things. We had a lot of fun here. More vegan and gluten free options would be awesome.

My husband and I decided to try "Cabo Wabo Cantina" on one of our nights out while in Vegas. We were highly disappointed. When we arrived I got a great glimpse at the hostess breasts. I am about to eat, WITH my husband now that is just disgusting! She was wearing half of a WHITE tank top, I could see her boobs completely except fro her nipple truly. It was just extremely unpleasant to begin with, at that moment we should have left, but we did not. A male hostess sat us, ignored me the whole time walked to the stable but had a full conversation with my husband, OK. We sat down, our waiter came by 5 minutes later, we asked for water and my husband ordered a Toasted Colada ($14), he said was ok. 75% ice. We also ordered our food, my husband got some Ceviche appetizer and I got Hot & Spicy Wings which I did not know came with a side of potato. The food was good, the service sucked. Besides taking our order, brining us our food, and our check we got NO SERVICE outside from that. Even if the food had been great, it was OK and the drink amazing, it was not. We would still never ever return to this place, and now when we return to Vegas we never will. The service was by far the worst I have ever gotten in Vegas. Super disappointed. The waiter had the audacity to circle the receipt what we should tip her. HAHA, seriously? My Tip was "Check on your tables". ! That's the BEST tip I am sure she has ever gotten. Recommend, NO Way! Go somewhere else!

Definitely a place you try for the experience and the environment. The food is o.k., but nothing special. Honestly I would likely not go back, but it is a nice place and of you're more of a drinker partier, then you will probably enjoy this place.

The food is horrible. Not authentic at all. It was so gross I took one bite of my over cheesed food. Yuck. Only thing good was the chips and guacamole which we had to pay for. The salsa is disgusting and overly salted ewww :( never again
Had a great breakfast here. Bloody Mary was excellent, pancakes and omelette were in point!  Will be here again.
Excellent service and excellent food! We ate breakfast and drank Bellinis. Definitely coming here again!

I have past this place every single day during my yearly stay in Vegas. I always wanted to try it, but didn't know how the heat would affect my dining experience seated at the patio. 

It was surprisingly a great experience and great food. You have a blocked view of the Bellagio water but I just loved watching crowds and crowds of people pass by. The band was great.

I received my free margarita upon checking-in on yelp. Margarita was very strong. I ordered the "Jack & Coke BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger" I have to tell you I wasn't expecting anything great but the first bite I fell in love with this Burger. I finished everything on the plate including fries which were also great.

Next time, I will be trying the Jack & Coke Ribs

What a beautiful place to sit and watch people and the bright lights of Vegas along the strip! Unfortunately the food was awful. Enchiladas verdes was too sweet, the chicken was tasteless, the rice was dry and flavorless, pinto beans had an "off" taste, and the asiago cheese smelled and tasted bad.  The salsa had a bitter and dark taste and the queso seemed to be a bit runny and tasted like stale beer.  I also felt like there was a phone signal jammer nearby used so that we could not use our phones and they could turn over the table. The waitresses took our check and our drinks and napkins and we weren't quiet finished wiping our hands. There are a lot of better places close by.
Had the pork tacos, flavor similar to tacos al pastor, but more tender pork. Good for people watching. Wait staff was very fast and friendly, meals came out quick.

Lunch out on the patio was fantastic!  Service was top-notch and food was stellar - I will return!  Our waitress (sorry forgot her name) was so great. I got the shrimp appetizer (cooked with tequila) YUMMM-EEEE!

No clue how this place stays open. Food is WAAAAY overpriced, as are the driniks; service is horrid.  Four of us: we ordered 2 ceviches, 2 carnitas sopes, chips/queso and a total of 6 margaritas (at $10 a pop), our bill was $127.  $127?! The carnitas sopes came two on a plate with black beans and rice. The sopes had NO flavor to them. Zip. Zilch. Nada. They had to be covered in salsa and queso to even make it tolerable. Our waitress was nice, she was new, but getting drinks took an act of Congress.  Once the margaritas came, we had to ask 3 times for water, that seemed to take the longest.  On a Thursday afternoon??  Really??  I think they were bringing it in by the bucketful from the Hoover Dam. 
I've been to Cabo Wabo in Cabo and we enjoyed ourselves and the service; and even though I didn't think it was possible, this one in Vegas both sucked AND blew.

Bad service at first but Jason took over and from that point on it was great. Lobster enchiladas were possibly the best food I've ever eaten. Checked the sampler too and it had some good things. Guacamole was pretty tasty. Decent beer price and a high energy atmosphere give it a try.

The six of us came here after going to Sugar Factory and having a negative experience due to the hostess Hilary to where we could not even dine. The service we are receiving here is excellent from hostess, our server Alicia, bussers, and food. We will come back here next trip which is already scheduled. Atmosphere is great, upbeat. Good mix of music.

Went for drinks and were asked if we wanted to sit at the bar; I replied if we can people watch from there. 
Hostess then said, Oh, we should put you on "the rail".
So, we sat at the rail, under the water mister, drank pricey (but not short on liquor) drinks,chatted, maybe even had a smooch?! and people watched, and watched the water show at the Bellagio.

Our waiter (Marco, Marcus?..tall guy with dark hair and accent) was speedy, attentive and polite...even when one request was only for some water! (he earned and received a good tip)

Someone came and took our "free postcard" picture...We may have purchased the "for pay" pic, if only she had posed us so we looked representable...not just aim and shoot!

We thought it was an hour+ well spent!!!!
Great location on the strip, live band playing, mango picante margarita...yum, steak fajitas....yum, love this place. Service was great too. Definitely will be back next time!!!!

My Girlfriend and I came here for a quick lunch while wandering around the strip. they have a fairly large and crowded patio that might offer some good views so long as you don't get stuck in the corner by the server station. The food was mediocre at best by my Phoenix standard for Mexican food. The service was a little slow as well.

As far as reasonable eats go on the strip you could probably do better but not without waiting.
This is a fun place to go.  Food is pretty good! atmosphere is fun and lively!  and if you are on the patio, people watching is the best!

This  place is absolutely amazing 
The food 
The service 
The drinks 
And the view of people walking in the st 
Best lunch option
Stopped in here after work before heading to the airport. Huge portions, strong margaritas, what's not to like?

As many times as I have been to Vegas and passed by this place and seen people walking around with those ridiculous guitars filled with alcohol, I thought its about time we give this place a try.

Your in a Mexican joint so you must get a margarita and we decided on the Cabo-rita. Yes, that is the name. Kinda clever and kinda not. The margaritas were decent, decent amount of alcohol, and a decent lime mixer was used. Not too bad for a trendy touristy joint like this.

We just landed in town and we were looking for munchies, so we got the following appetizers:
* Lobster Taquitos - I actually like these a lot. A little too much. I would definitely order it again next time.
* Some Grilled Shrimp in Butter Sauce Dish (forgot the name of it) - This was excellent as well. The only negative was there wasn't more of it on the plate.

Overall, Cabo Wabo Cantina has good food and decent drinks. I can definitely see myself hanging out on the deck outside, getting smashed drinking margaritas, and eating good food. The only negatives to the place is the wait staff can be a little slow at times and our waitress would hide out so it was difficult getting another drink. All things considered, I give Cabo Wabo Catina 4 stars.

HORRIBLE SERVICE, waiter dropped of plate of mixed sauces ranch, tarter sauce, all over of my friend. And all he said was are you okay and walked off without saying anything, people need to learn to have better customer service.

I just went there for the Super Bowl party and I was really impressed with the service and the food!  The wings were delicious and the servers came by very often!  It was generally just a really fun event!
Tuna ceviche so tasty. Burrito insanely drenched in mountains of cheese. Fast drink service and fun loud atmosphere. I'll be back.

In search of food and out of the blistering heat of 103 degrees of Las Vegas, we ended up here just because we couldn't walk any farther. My soles were getting blisters.
The pitcher of margarita was average, but the steak nachos were awful!. The chips and steak were dry and no flavors were flattering my taste buds. At least the presentation was pretty...haha

That's what happens when you're desperate and don't read Yelp reviews.
Fun atmosphere.  The food is simply not that great.  And expensive even for Vegas.  Would come back for the beer specials and live music but not for the food.
Cool place. Great atmosphere. Bartender was just ok. Confusing Happy Hour. When the sign states 2 for 1 drinks for Happy Hour isn't it for everything ? Vague signage to draw people in.. ?

In my opinion, it doesn't get better than Cabo Wabo - I don't know why the reviews are mediocre.  It's an awesome location for people watching right on the strip.  The food is good, not great, but it's reasonable quality for bar food.  The food and drinks are reasonably priced for Vegas and it's a great spot to sit out on the patio and chill for a few hours with a pitcher of beer (as long as you don't want to watch a game).  Not a good place to watch a game outside - most of the TVs are inside.  Overall, great experience for what we were looking for.

I loved the guacamole and lobster enchiladas. The sauce was sweet and spicy, my favorite tastes. The free margarita with check in was a great treat as were the birthday shots they brought us for our friends birthday!
The margaritas are fantastic, the service was great and the appetizers were pretty good.

My woman and I came to this Cabo Wabo one afternoon and I had been wanting to check it out being a Sammy Hagar Fan and Mostly VH fan so I was pretty stoked.  We were able to sit on the patio rail which is the best dining seat aside from Bubba Gumps Patio seat so far in Vegas.... ( on the Strip I haven't had the pleasure of too many balcony Seat's thus far,  Still to come)  The patio is right across the street from the Belagio hence you get to check out the Water show (which is awesome) every 1/2 hour.  Also it's kinda the heart of the strip so People watching is pretty cool as well.  We were sat and waited on in plenty good time.  Everyone was very nice but quick.  I ordered Queso Fondido Con Chorizo and no alcohol since we don't drink although that part of the place looked like it did exceptionally well.  The Queso was super donkey good.... I loved that more than anything.  I would go back for that alone... even above the Patio Rail seating.  We ordered the Combo 2 (Gulf Shrimp & Grilled Top Sirloin) Fajita's.  They were good not the best but the accoutrements (grilled onions, peppers, cheese, Sour Cream & Such)  were awesome that were with them... The steak was just a tad tough and since the Shrimp while large were Jumbo Gulf Shrimp they were not plentiful however, all the same it was an above average Fajita dish.  All in All after touring the rest of the restaurant (A.K.A visit to the local johns and the Big Red Wall of hanging Photo's of Sammy and Friends) I thought it was an awesome place to eat and hang... I will return and not soon enough most likely.  I will however most likely get Taco's next time since those are my favorite Mex food. Oh, and as to why I gave it 4 Stars instead of 5 the music was very loud and I play and sing rock music (so, that is to say I love loud music) and the music here was super loud almost too much to even hear the sever.   ~Vegas Rob!

This place happened to be really close by while we were waiting to check into our hotel.  Unfortunately, this place wasn't good at all.  I ordered the fish tacos.  They weren't very well seasoned and the salsa was pretty bland.  The cheese dip was probably the worst I've ever experienced at a restaurant and that's saying a lot given the amount of Mexican food I eat.  The only decent thing I had was the margarita (although severely overpriced) because it's hard to go too terribly wrong with tequila.

Do yourself a favor and stay far away from this place.

We came here last night for a late supper and  a bunch of drinks.  They have a nice railing to sit at at look at the passers by.  There is a bit of the view of the Bellagio fountain.  Too bad the seats were so uncomfortable.   We had tacos for supper.  I really liked my shrimp tacos. They were soft shelled tacos which is good as that makes them easier to control.  Fried shrimpa and I Thi k the crispy fries onions on top cane it a nice crunch. Tony had braised rib tacos I think.  Also good he reported.    The drinks were as expected.  I really did not like the I can't drive 55. But the ice tea was good.

I'm compelled to join Yelp and add my review of this place.  Simply put, the food is not good, and overpriced.  I wouldn't mind so much the expense if it was good, but it was bad.  Just bad.

When my partner and I arrived, we were seated by the hostess pretty quickly -- it was late on a week night.  We chose to sit outside, perfect spot for people watching.  We were informed that our waitress would be with us shortly.  "She was in the bathroom"!?  We waited and waited, and then waited.  Finally after she finished up in the bathroom , she arrived to take our order with indifference.  Apparently, we interrupted her potty time.

A long time later, some other guy brought us our food.  I ordered the combo plate --  2 taquitos and a tamale.  The taquitos were approximately 3 inches long each.  Finger food.. the kind you get in the frozen section at your grocery store.  The tamale was approximately half the size of the typical tamale you get at any other Mexican food restaurant, and about as good as a Swanson frozen dinner selection.  My partners fajitas smelled, and looked much better.  I wished I had ordered them.  He later informed me they were rather bland.  Not even on par with Chili's or any other chain restaurant.

Ok the drinks.... we both ordered the margaritas.  $10 for a small plastic cup!!  These were the kind you can get down on Fremont Street for a buck, and maybe not as good.  

Advice if you must go here --  Drink soda, sit on the patio for prime people watching, and don't order a combo plate.  Don't expect good food, so have some nachos or something.   Surely they can't screw those up, but I can't attest to it.  I didn't order those.

I'm surprise this place stays open, I assume it does good business since it's conveniently located on the strip.

take my advice and save yourself and eat somewhere else.

-they charged ridiculous prices for Mexican food. Expect $10-15 per person for a small plate. I order the 2 combo with rice, beans, chicken soft taco and tamale. It was not filling, and definitely not tasty. 
-chips and salsa was below par. 
-the guacamole was $10!!! for a small serving. The waitress did not bother telling us how much it was. 
-incompetent workers. Seriously, how hard is it get hot water? first time, you brought out cold water. We asked for hot water.
-Don't bother asking for suggestions, their not at all familiar with their menu!
We love this place! Great food, great service.  We eat here every time we're in Vegas. Enjoy!

Don't bother booking a party because they will not plan properly either way.  We called ahead 2 weeks in advance, verified the reservation the night before and still had to wait 30 minutes for our table.  We were so spread out for our party of 12 no one could talk to each other.  Food is good and waitresses are very sweet. So for a small party, you're fine. But not the place for a big party.

I was drawn to this place by the awesome atmosphere and great location. The group I was with was a total of six people but they were very accommodating. The best thing about our experience was our awesome server Laura. Five out of the six people I was with are servers and every single person was impressed with her personality, great customer service and likability. If you ever go there, ask for her because she is awesome!

I had a great Mexican chopped salad with grilled shrimp in a cilantro lime vinaigrette while seated at the outside bar on a gorgeous day. Well seasoned, delicious,  and a good portion size. It looked so good that 4 people around me ordered the same thing!

Just horrible,  overpriced, no flavor and just all out bad.  My fiance and I  shared an enchilada plate and we each got a drink, and nothing was worth the price.  Our waitress said the drinks were strong and they weren't.  The food was bland.  Nothing special, taco bell would have been better.  Stay away unless you like tourist traps, bad food, and bad service.

Great food great service a little disturbing though that we ask for a jalapeño and the cook charged us $2 for a pepper! Gotta watch out for that here. Manager took it off but in my opinion it shouldn't of been there. If you are going to charge for something as ridiculous as a jalapeño you should disclose it not just put it on a bill. Kinda ruined my experience 
Awesome wait staff tho

Standard Mexican food at sky high prices-- it's Vegas, check your expectations.  I had the carnitas platter and it was fine.  Nothing special and the pork was super dry, but definitely edible.  Luckily, I had a delicious cactus pear margarita to help me choke down the dry carnitas.  You have to pay for chips, but they give you a gigantic basket of it.  The service was surprisingly good for a busy restaurant.  All in all, not a bad experience, but definitely nothing to go out of your way for.  For the price, there are better options in Vegas, but if you have a hankering for Mexican food and margaritas, Cabo Wabo will hit the spot just fine.
Super friendly staff and the nachos are the best we have ever had!! We loved it! Everything was delicious and the staff was amazing

Cabo Wabo definitely is more hype than come thru.

Went there for drinks and food with one of my work colleagues. Waitresses are definitely dressed for tips as it's Vegas, but thought it'd be slightly classier coming from the staff. Only individual drinks applied for the happy hour, but you save more still getting the pitcher. Wasn't a very good deal, disappointing.

Food was beyond average. Tasted like something I could buy at the grocery store, so taking a guess everything is just freezed to prep. It's right along the strip, but still kind of taken back by how overpriced everything was. I wish we had went elsewhere, won't be returning.

Cool atmosphere, great location and the bartenders were great. Ordered mainly margaritas, mango and cucumber. They were both good but the cucumber was really the superior of the 2. Their prices were slightly high but i feel like those are the prices in Vegas. A pitcher of specialty margarita was $46 dollars without tax. I loved the music and their happy hour as well ;)

I am surprised about the overall reviews. The food isn't bad. Prices are good. The cabo wabo margarita I got was WAY too sugary. I loved the guacamole!! If you are in the area and hungry, try it. I wouldn't go out of you're way to come here though
We went in first time for lunch, great food,& service by Jordon. We went back several times would recommend every time.great music & drinks great   Place to hang out

So I don't know why I checked in here for my recent visit to Vegas although I did come here when I visited previously last time I was here in 2011. Don't even remember what I had here almost 5 years ago to tell you the truth so being that other than knowing that I did eat here a long time ago I'll just go with it was okay...lol. I'll make sure to stop by my next go-around to Vegas to update my review.

I wish I could give this place more stars, but as a TexMex lover from Texas, I just can't bring myself to do it. The chips don't taste homemade at all. The salsa is pretty gross. The queso tastes like total shit. Literally, like a block of Velveta microwaved with nothing added in. The only thing this place has going for it is location, sangria, and an awesome server named Pete.
My sweetie and I came here for our anniversary.  The management took better care of us than we could have ever dreamed. Staff, food, view... all amazing. Highly recommend! We'll be back again!

I was pleasantly surprised by Cabo Wabo Cantina!  Definitely make sure to ask for a seat on the patio outside; it has a gorgeous view of the Strip, and had great live music while we were there.  

I got the short rib barbacoa tacos and they were outstanding!  The meat fell apart and everything tasted fresh.  My husband also really enjoyed his chicken enchiladas, and the drinks were great.  I will say that the chips and salsa were not what we expected; the salsa is not really a traditional salsa, and tastes very much like chipotle chiles. 

The service was good, though the prices were a bit high (what isn't in Vegas?)  I would definitely recommend if you're near Planet Hollywood and looking for something with a great view.

Great place to watch the ballagio water show.... I left a pool party at Marquee and was able to cool down and chill with a appetizer sampler and a house margarita in my swim suit and take in the atmosphere. It was a quick walk from the cosmopolitan and the patio was elevated just enough that I see over the crowds in the strip. The inside looks pretty small so oitdoors was great esp with the mist spray on. The menu seems really good. Classic dishes with a modern twist. The bbq chicken wings were awesome along with the chips and salsa. I loved the queso dip with my taquitos. The sampler was enough to feed me and 3 others. The fish tacos were amazing and the chipotle sauce they add to it made it complete! The service was fast, friendly and they were always checking on us despite the full crowd they had going on. Can't wait to try something else on the menu next time....

They have done more to piss people off with a Groupon they don't honor.  Would have been better off not having a Groupon.  We only had 3 people instead of 4 so they refused to honor the Groupon.  Hello people, 3 would eat less and it would cost you less.  Rude manager!  Offered to give me $30 I paid not $60 value.  We left and I will get a refund from Groupon.  Talk about bait and switch!!!!  Plus they have way too many table shoved together, felt like I was sitting with the people next to me.

Awful experience the morning of 3/9/17. Our party of three arrived and waited at the hostess stand to be seated. The hostess was flirting with a table of guys so we had to wait a few minutes before we were even acknowledged. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table which was reasonable considering how busy it was. When we were seated she places us along the rail right in the direct sun. When we asked if we could possibly be moved further down the rail into the shady side she just walked away without a word. 

Our server Brian M. greeted our table right away but it was all downhill after that. It took 20 minutes for him to arrive with our drinks. When our food came out, everyone's entrees came out except for mine. Our server never returned to check on us. Finally my friend walked over to another server asking her to please send him over. He came over and I explained I never received my entree. By this time ten minutes had passed since everyone else had gotten their food. Another ten minutes go by and finally Brian M. returns with my dish completely unapologetic. He was gone again before we could ask to order another round of drinks. 

The food was just okay, nothing spectacular. There are many other great choices along the strip. We will never return to this establishment..
Great outdoor seating and such a fun place to have dinner with friends. Great food and delicious cocktails. Highly recommend.

I have been to this Cabo wabo 2 times.  This is Sammy Hagar restaurant. He is the founder and owner of all the locations. Thhis Cabo wabo is located on the strip infront of planet Hollywood. 

They offer indoor and outdoor seating. The location is pretty big. Both times I ate here it was lunch. We dident have to make any reservations. The inside is all beach island rock and roll themed. There is a stage inside. The music playing on the speakers are loud. It's a good family spot. 

The food is chain style food Mexican flair food. The prices are good. I wasn't hungry this time. My cousin was starving tho. I just ordered a shot of vodka. With a chips and queso. The queso was good. Took a long time to get the queso. The waiter appologozed. My cousin ordered the grilled chicken mountain thingy. He ate the whole thing and said it was amazing. 

Overall Cabo wabo is a solid spot. It's a chain like Hard Rock Cafe or a margaritaville . But different food. The food was good for the price. Nothing special tho. Give it a try. If you like beachy and rock

The inside dining area is too loud! I'm no grandma but I'd like to hold a conversation over lunch without having to yell like I'm in the club.

Rock Shrimp Tacos 3 for $15....ouch but yum. (best with plenty of lemons) $20 for Chicken Fajitas were alright but I liked the shrimp tacos better, the fajitas weren't as memorable.

Then we watched the staff do the Cha Cha Slide in front of the whole restaurant, it was awkward because nobody really cared for it and the staff wasn't that into it anyways. Portions aren't hearty for their prices but other than that it's still quality fresh mex.

Amazing food, great prices. 

We ordered the fajitas and thus far they're the best we've ever had. We also were pleasantly surprised when our child's kid order came with two delicious churros!

Fun entertainment, great bar location, Best bartender, fun drinks that are always well made!

I've seen lots of places change over the years. Like New Orleans, the drinks got more expensive while the mixes got more sugar (less alcohol). Cabo Wabo is not one of those places. They stay competitive on the prices of the Vegas strip but the main thing is that you get what you pay for here! Alcohol! The mixes are delicious and the drinks are real.

The bartender was very friendly, had lots of energy, amazingly quick no matter how many customers they had, and had lots of fun while keeping the professional feel. That's amazing! We knew then, that Vegas only hired the best of the best.

We sat at the bar which is nicely situated facing the Bellagio fountains. It held an outdoor feeling without getting burned due to the architecture of the venue and had a fun energetic and interactive entertainer.

We had some light snacks which were surprisingly flavorful and innovative. Thanks! And thanks for taking a group pic of all of us with you guys included with our phone since you're the ones that made our vacation awesome! Great memories, Great times.

Tried Cabo Wabo in Vegas because the outside was eye catching. The food was ok, I had one of their burgers (can't remember the name of it) and their Mai Tai. The Mai Tai was delicious! The decor was cool but the music they were playing kinda didn't go with the whole vibe the place. The hostess looked like she was 10 years old w/tattoos all over, that was a bit creepy and we had no idea who our waiter/waitress was because they kept changing and no one told us anything or introduced themselves to us, so when we needed something we were kinda scratching our heads, because one minute someone was coming to our table asking if everything was good the next they weren't trying to help us but someone else would (& not that we kept calling them over because we weren't, maybe once or twice). Leaving the place was difficult. We couldn't find anyone to give us our check, all of sudden no one was around for like 15 mins, that was odd. Will I recommend this place to friends, probably not.
The food and atmosphere where great! The service was quick and friendly! The delicious tacos and margaritas were a perfect combo! Reasonably priced.
Very nice location and view with overpriced mediocre food!
Really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Great food. The service is a little slow but your in Vegas so take your time and enjoy..
Food was ok, but it wasn't worth it for the food poisoning. I probably wouldn't have returned just based on the so-so food, but no one wants to have their trip ruined by bad food.

totally over rated. no taste. chips and horrible salsa are an extra $4!!!! my son ordered chicken fingers they were over cooked (hard!) and the service is even worse! our waiter was either drunk, high, or having a mild heart attack? everything was just bad!
$11 for a washing-machine margarita on the Strip? Rude service, and the bar is chilly and drafty in the winter. Not sure why I got suckered into going here, but never again.
Albert was an amazing server! He was super quick and friendly. I will definitely be going back. The food was great and so were the drinks!

I generally enjoyed this place.  I'm kind of a Rock and Roll fan and really enjoy Sammy's work (Chickenfoot Rocks!).  So, when I got the chance to go to one of his signature joints, it was a no brainer.  

First the drinks.  I had the Waborita.  Three of them actually.  They were, as expected, really good.  I've had Cabo Wabo tequila before and it's a good tequila.  These drinks were large and packed a punch.  Not to mention, they tasted good.

Second, the food.  The food was also good.  The portions were large.  Not super large.  But not small.  The food tasted good and the ingredients tasted fresh.  The salsa, which they claimed was XXX spicy, was not what I expected as XXX spicy.  It was hot though and tasted good.  

Next, the service.  Service was prompt.  The waitress was attentive to our needs and friendly.  Really couldn't ask for much more!

The price.  It's a bit on the high side.  But then again, you are in Las Vegas.  If you are looking for cheap Mexican-ish food, there are plenty of Chipotles and Taco Bells floating around.  The quality here is better.  Expect to pay more.  

Lastly, the atmosphere.  This is where I have my only real complaint about this place.  It felt like Jay Z, Pitbull, and Drake were on loop play, with the occasional rock song thrown in.  I know there are people that like that crap, but come on!  This is Sammy Hagar's place.  Play some damn Rock and Roll!

All in all, I recommend it.  Just be prepared to spend a bit above average and to hear some crappy hip hop pop junk music.

Me and  my  husband  went there  today  for  first  time  i really  enjoyed  the food and drinks  i liked  the atmosphere  was a little  pricey but when  my service  and  food  is good  i can  not complain  will  be  back

The breakfast is excellent, lunch or dinner is ok I own a Mexican restaurant so I know about food, the reason on my 5 starts is the overall rating, love the uniforms, concept so that's how you get a 5

The service received by Tamara today far exceeded my expectations. She was beyond attentive and genuine in her service delivery. She should be commended for her ability to build brand loyalty through her commitment in providing gracious and humble service.
If you are in Las Vegas and want to experience great food AND great service, GO to Cabo Wabo at the Planet Hollywood.

Had lunch here I had the barbacoa tacos and my boyfriend had the carne asada. Also had the guacamole appetizer. All were super good. Plus their rocking iced tea is delicious. Our server Mariah was super nice and attentive. Great place for lunch. Misters and umbrellas make the heat tolerable.

Typical Vegas chain. Been here twice now and I can say the food is consistently OK. Kind of like an On The Border with a smaller menu and way more tequila options. Speaking of which, their tequila flight is reasonably priced (for Vegas) and worth it if you are looking to start your day off on that foot. Service was just ok the first time but the second time I was with a large group and service was excellent. Bathrooms are kinda weird, when you walk in you'll know what I mean. Misters on the patio in the summer which some people love. Not a bad place but not a Vegas destination by any means.

Food was enjoyable. A bit pricey for the type of food (which is why i rated it a 3 star)  but the meat was tender, the margarita was good and the food was plentiful.  I liked having the option to sit on the deck and overlook the strip while eating. We spent $56 on one margarita, a plate of three tacquitos, 1 small bowl of queso/chips and a fajita.   I could see spending, maybe $30 but not $56.

We sat outside to enjoy The Strip view and were treated to a good, quick lunch. We ordered food and in less than 10 minutes it was at our table. Amazing. Try the tacos al carbon platter, street tacos on corn tortillas with fresh ingredients and nice spices.

The wait staff was laid back and cool. A great view and a nice meal.
Stopped on for a margarita. Ordered the the CW top shelf margarita and it was sad, so sad. We sent it back and left. We will not be back. They used to be such a great resturant. Sad, so sad.

I came here on St. Patrick's day and even though the strip was super busy we were sat on the patio immediately. The service was spectacular, our server was attentive and nice and our food came out in a timely fashion. I got the chicken tacos and they were AMAZING. Some of the best Mexican food I've had on the strip. Would definitely come here again next time I'm in the area.

There is no way this restaurant should be classified as Mexican.

The good stuff first: I came here because of the location - it's one of the few restaurants that have an open patio on the strip. Great for people watching and checking out the Bellagio fountains.

Now the bad stuff: the food sucks. I felt like tacos and the server recommended the grilled fish tacos. He said they were really popular. I like fish tacos so I went with his recommendation. When I got my plate, there was a huge side of disgusting goopy fried beans (I had asked if they were black beans), oddly dry and favourless fried rice, and 2 very sad looking fish tacos. The tacos consisted of a thin strip of cold dry fish jerky with some shreds of lettuce and tomatoes. I managed to eat one taco and a few scoops of rice because I was hungry and left everything else on my place. The server took my plate away and didn't even ask about my meal. I really should have complained but I was just too tired to even deal with it.

I might come back for drinks on the patio but I would be scared to try their food again!!
Great food, excellent margaritas. Also, great views of the Bellagio fountains. Mediocre service

Maybe my expectations were too high for Cabo Wabo, but since I am a big fan of Sammy Hagar's song "Heavy Metal" from the Heavy Metal Soundtrack, I convinced my boyfriend to go here with me one night on our Vegas trip.

For one, a cockroach crawled across the middle of our table before our food arrived. We were in the outside cantina area, so maybe this can't be CW's fault, but several of the nearby tables were dirty and seeing that was pretty gross. 

Since we didn't leave after the cockroach incident (why) we were there to receive our steak and chicken fajitas for 1 to split. They were really, really bland. We discussed whether they had forgotten to season them or if this was the intended taste. As Texans we could not come to a conclusion about how this happened or what was going on. I've seen many 5 star reviews of this place so I'm now completely confused. We should have sent them back but were just a bit embarrassed. Our waitress was really nice and we felt bad for her. 

Finally we got the bill for $60, after two drinks, an appetizer and the most bland fajitas of all time. Not worth it.

The food was okay. There was a lot of it. The place was clean, but the table situation was very crowded. And the music overhead was SO LOUD! I get it. It's a rock & roll place, but I should be able to hear my own conversation. The service wasn't bad, either.

This was definitely the most disappointing meal I had in Vegas.  I'm accustomed to the concept of overpriced food on the Strip, so I couldn't totally fault this place for being any different in that respect.  The chips and salsa were great, and they were promptly delivered.  We ordered two combo plates, a Corona, and a house margarita.  The food was good: not spectacular, not horrible...just good.  We ordered the churros afterwards, and again, just good.  They had nice flavor, but were a bit on the overcooked side.  When the waitress finally brought the check around, though, we were appalled to see that a standard sized bottle of Corona was $9 and the small plastic cup of house margarita was $11!  Seriously?  The larger "specialty" margaritas that the table next to us ordered were only a couple dollars more and looked to be at least twice the size!  I was glad that we declined the refills she offered.

Overall, I wouldn't go back or recommend to friends.  The service was slow (with the exception of the free chips and salsa), and our server was inattentive bordering on rude.  The food was average for the most part.  Drinks were average and overpriced, even by Vegas standards.

Came here for lunch. Waited 20 min for a shaded outdoor table & got one half shaded. Asked hostess for a more shaded table, she said i had to wait... um isnt that what i just did?? Came inside, waitress took over 10 min to greet us. Drinks we ordered sat at the bar for over 5 so I got up to get them. One corona was warm. My crispy taco fell apart in the first bite, shrimp taco was super watery. Bad experience, will not come back.
Food was great, really excellent. Fish taco special, my wife had some kind of spicy pork taco, we had the guacamole app.  The mohitos were also excellent. Service was excellent.

My experience here was not the best.  I only give it 2 stars because their fajitas were pretty good. And even that wasn't worth the price. The atmosphere is loud and crowded and the service was terrible. Everybody was pretty rude. The drinks were okay, but again, overpriced since they were not strong. I wouldn't come back, that's for sure.

YUM!! My husband and I got lunch here while we were in Vegas. We shared the Dos Ceviches and the Appetizer Sampler! SO GOOD! Highly recommend the ceviche. Will definitely be back next time we're in town!

Don't bother!  I purchased a groupon for here and not only did they try to refuse it.when we came back 2 hours later for drinks they gave us even more nasty attitude.  Not the servers mind you the manager.  I reported this to Groupon and got a full refund for the terrible experience.

And to top it off the food is not worth the prices, it's good for about half as much money.

I say again DO NOT GO HERE!!! There are MUCH BETTER PLACES!

Went here the weekend of the infamous Mayweather vs. Pacquiao fight. This restaurant was located inside of Planet Hollywood. It was extremely crowded that weekend. However, when the four of us entered this restaurant, we were seated and serviced quickly. The food was awesome! Customer service was good, but wasn't excellent. However, no one was rude. They did what they were supposed to, but wasn't exactly working for tips as it relates to service with a smile.. That is the only reason I didn't give this establishment a 5 star rating. I would definitely go back though.

Service was AWFUL. After being seated we had to wait at least 10-15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us, and it was this arrogant rushed server that didn't even apologize for making us wait. 

The place felt grimy and dirty. Hard uncomfortable chairs and dirty booths. 

Drinks were terrible. I got the toasted colada with coconut on the rim that basically was a glass of ice with a little pineapple and coconut juice splashed in for looks. $15 for a glass of ice. My husband got the "I can't drive 55" and made it a double and it was $25!!! He barely got a buzz. 

Food was ok.  Chips and salsa were good, salsa was different, like a smoky salsa. They gave a massive amount of chips. 

We got beef tacos, they were ok. I got the Mexican style chopped salad. It was nice and fresh and I liked that they added celery. But I asked for grilled chicken to be added and when the salad came out I thought they forgot the chicken. Then I looked more closely and there was the tiniest bit of cubed chicken on the side. What a rip off. 

Our bill came to $85. I nearly had a heart attack when I saw that bill.  It really bothered me that I wasted money on such a barely mediocre place with terrible service. Would never ever go there again. Go to Nacho Daddy instead which has way better food, service and prices.

Stopped here with the intention of doing some serious people watching.   Asked the hostess for a table for two facing the strip and she obliged with two seats looking directly over the strip.

We ordered a pitcher of pear margarita, and although I am not a huge margarita fan, this concoction was good and I certainly had my share.   We also ordered the appetizer sampler.  The sampler was the perfect amount of food and it was good (as good as bar food gets).

Our server was happy, attentive, and did a wonderful job.   The prices are a bit on the high side but considering the view and the environment it was worth the price of admission. I forgot to mention that they had a live band playing.

If you are in Vegas and want to people watch day or night this is an excellent location.

We came to eat there great chimichanga to our disappointment they took it of the menu  so ordered the Carne asada tacos not  good to much fat on the meat, the chicken enchiladas were good .. Service was good

I'll preface this review with, due to the horrible Customer service at the hostess stand, we did not even get to experience the food. Being a Vegas resident and someone that works in hospitality myself on the the strip I will never recommend this restaurant. My fiancé and I were spending a weekend on the strip and walked over from Paris for Mexican food. We put our name on the waiting list and we're quoted 15 minutes. We walked around the area within a minute walk returned back to the hostess stand w/in 10 minutes to check in and were told our table had been called, we missed it and would have to start the wait again if we wanted to dine there. And we're told "we needed to stay around once our name was on the list" which we explained we were never told when we originally placed our name on the list. We were then quoted another 15 minutes for a table. Needless to say with the vast selection of restaurants on the strip we will never dine nor recommend any of our guests/family friends Cabo Wabo.
I mean Really!! Las Vegas Strip view Bar with a 3rd world Food And Service!! I dont wanna go there!! I dont wanna waste more of my time writting a Bad Review!!

This review is only for the bar that faces out into the shops at planet hollywood. I'm giving it 4 stars because I loved the convenience and never had to wait! We would just walk up and get a shot or a drink on our way out of the hotel! Several times we had a really sweet young girl who said she was new, a few times we had a woman was kind of a...well...you know.  We got frozen drinks, fireball shots, regular margaritas and one time the coconut margarita I had seen on yelp.  Everything was fine but the last one. It was borderline gross and the caramel that they put on the glass to hold the coconut dripped all over me, my clothes, my purse and then the end table in my room.  I was bummed because I had been looking forward to that drink for months after seeing it on line. That drink could have been awesome, they need to rework the recipe for it.
The nachos were good but the margaritas were extremely over priced, they tasted good and looked pretty but I'm not sure if there was any alcohol in them at all.

This was one of my favourite meals in Vegas.  I asked the concierge at my hotel where she recommended we go for breakfast, and this is where she sent us.

Service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious.  Except for the breakfast quesadilla.  It was agreed that that was the biggest let down and was just kind of "strange".

My meal however, was delicious.  I had the CW Eggs on a skillet with Chorizo added.  The chorizo wasn't overly spicy or greasy.  Potatoes were perfect, and everything was topped off with a scrambled egg.
