I don't know if the staff was burnt out from partying the previous night but some looked like they have make up on from last night. The host are point of contact and I'm huge on customer service. The girls in the front have NO personality what so ever. Rude, no smile, plain straight face that looked like they own that damn podium stand, haha. Another girl who handled the drinks in the front looked at me up and down and rolled her eyes. Whoa, girl I was just wear a trench coat completely covered up. Seriously?! What kind of restaurant? Eh, when in VEGAS, I'll leave cabowabo alone. 2 stars for good wings, less 3 stars for terrible customer service.. I mean who wants to deal with attitude before even getting served.
Was OK.  Just a traditional tourist stop.  Bought a tee shirt,.  Reasonable prices for beverages. Glad I visited now checking it off as a place in visited.  Long trip from the JW or secrets.

The margaritas here are about the best I've ever had.  Ice is blended so smooth it was like a fine slush.  Mix and flavor were perfect too.  On the other hand, the food was extremely disappointing.  Had the chicken fajitas and they were not very good. Chicken was good, but everything else lacked flavor.  I've had much better Mexican food at chain restaurants.  I would go back for the margaritas, but I would,eat elsewhere.

Happy Hour was such a steal! Our server was awesome and told us about the HH and we ordered so many drinks because it was so cheap! The food was delicious and the margaritas were so good! Definitely got me tipsy on a good one.

The area was generally pretty clean..a little sticky, but nothing too crazy. It's right along the busy parts of the strip so it was perfect to stop right in for some cold drinks!

Husband and I were walking around and saw where they served breakfast 2 eggs, toast, meat, potatoes and unlimited mimosa's for $5.99 and we had to do it, it was only around 9am but why not we were in Vegas I mean. The food was very good and everything was done just right. The mimosa's were served in a beer glass so these were quite big and I had 4 of them, my husband had 3. We had to take a nap afterwards but it was worth it:)

Had a great experience with the staff. Very helpful with my wrong coupon from groupon and we're able to help me out. The food was delicious. Had the tequila shrimp plate. Will def return to this place.

two stars : two reasons

location
late night dining

we were desperate and hungry.  this place was open.  we sat outside (nice).

margaritas were nasty, premixed, preservative laden crap.

did the apps sampler, at least we got some food in the belly. 

if you absolutely must, you'll probably survive :)

Needed some of Sammys famous Mexican food and a margarita. Ordered the carne asada taco plate which does nit come with sour cream or cheese so if like me and need these on tacos order in addition, and only the sour cream was extra. Sampled this time just the house margarita which was surprising very good, and had too just to ensure potency.

The staff here is amazing and so is the atmosphere of the restaurant. What else is better rocking music from the 80s like Van Hagar and Journey. With great art that adorns the walls of all of Sammys triumphs in life.

Service is ridiculous! I ordered an appetizer sampler for take out and when I got to the hotel I was missing part of my order for chicken wings. I called the restaurant back and let them know the issue and considering they were the ones who messed up my order there was nobody willing to remedy the situation. The best they could Do was have me either walk back tonight or tomorrow to pick up 4 pieces of wings. This is the worst experience I've had with an establishment when they've messed up my order. I will not return to this place and do not recommend anyone to go here. I'm all about service at any restaurants I go to and working in the service industry that's a very important piece.

Fast service!!!

We were last minute trying to find something good to eat before heading to the airport, despite it looking busy (judging by the packed patio), we went in and were greeted & seated immediately! 

Our waiter was nice & very attentive! He came back to check on us often and made sure we had everything we needed. 

We ordered guacamole for an appetizer & chicken tacos for our main entree. They offer complimentary chips and salsa. The guacamole was fresh & very good, they are very generous with their portions - we couldn't even finish it. You definitely get your moneys worth! The tacos were good as well. Very filling. 

Overall prices were decent. 

It's a big and spacious restaurant! Located right off the The Strip. 

I'm happy we stopped by last minute!

Sarah was fantastic, she took us on a culinary journey...nachos...tacos...margaritas...spicy salsa...her service was a cut above the rest...we were absolutely enamored with our meal...our only recommendation was that the chicken was SHREDDED chicken on the nachos...if you don't come here and ask for Sarah...well, you're just a fool

Great Food, Great Drinks, Vegas, What else can you ask for!
I can't believe this place has bad review.
Come on ppl, you're on the strip, drinks will be expensive and if you bought bad groupons, it's your fault for not reading the find print lol
Anyways...this was our last stop before heading home.
Had a drink to sober up ;) Cadillac margarita, strong enough to even us out!
We got sat right away, party of 8.
Our server was super cool and friendly. Even after a table walked out in her and left her with a $90 check. SO messed up. But who wouldn't be bummed after that? So it didn't matter to us. She knew everything about the menu and sold me the house special like it was gold on a plate haha did I regret it? NO. It was fish on top of dirty rice and this green sauce, which I call chimichurri back home. AMAZING combination of flavors.
Everyone was super satisfied with their food.
I'm not gonna lie, the kitchen did mess up on 2 orders but they also fixed a special plate for one of us.
Everyone mentioned the chips and salsa on their reviews and they are right! the salsa is just perfect and super addicting...
We got a super cute group pic taken by the photographer that works there, perfect to end our trip.
I had a great experience here and I will come back next time I'm in town!
Server was horrible. Didn't tell us who he was, explain the menu, etc. Service was worse than Waffle House @3am. Food was EXCELLENT. Stay out of Erick M's section.

I would give this place no stars if I could.  This will go down as one of the worst dining/bar experiences I have ever had.  I like Sammy Hagar, I like patios and I like tequila, but there is nothing to like about this place.  Okay, maybe the patio for the simple fact that the people watching is great and it's a great location on the strip.  

I love food and I'm not ashamed of the fact that I like to get my grub on.  So, for me to leave a restaurant and NOT EAT MY FOOD really says something.  That is exactly what happened at this establishment.

A server took our drink order.  Ten minutes later, we got our water and beer.  Then, over 25 minutes went by before he came back for our food order.  No exaggeration.  All of this could have been overlooked had the server been nice (he wasn't) and/or the food been good (it wasn't).  It took an hour for us to get our order of nachos and fish tacos.  I ordered nachos because I thought, "how do you screw up nachos?"  Well, Cabo Wabo has found a way.  The nachos consisted of about 12 individual tortilla chips and each chip had this meat cheese crustiness.  The overall effect was dog food.  My nachos looked like dog food.  They had a really weird taste too.  And the fish tacos looked better but tasted equally bad.  We literally got our check and left without eating our food.  And left a 10% tip due to the bad service, even though it killed me to do it.

I enjoy a good tourist spot.  They're overpriced and a little cheesy, but sometimes I dig it.  If you want a good tourist trap, visit Margaritaville.  I've never had bad food or bad service there and that place is incredibly busy.  Oh, Sammy.  Why????

Their CW Margarita is delish!  I like Sammy Hagar and I love his place.  We got the steak quesadilla, and while very rich, it was very tasty!  I can't say enough about the margarita though, it was great, I had to have another!

It was actually a pretty quiet night when my wife and I came in here to eat. The outside portion of the restaurant was crowded and loud and we were initially reluctant to try it out but once we peeked inside it looked pretty sedate. So we decided to give it a shot.

We ordered the Grilled Top Sirloin Fajitas for two with beans and rice on the side. The food was really good. I enjoyed it a lot. I wish that they would bring more tortillas though. The waiter only brought three for each of us. We breezed through those pretty quick and had to ask for some more because there was still a lot of meat and veggies that we hadn't finished that we needed to wrap up. The waiter apparently expected that we would need more from the beginning because when he brought the food he told us to let him know when we needed more. Why wouldn't he have just given us more at the start? They should bring five tortillas per order, not three.

For a drink I had the Sammy's Toasted Colada which was a bit fruity for my taste. It was okay but I wouldn't order it again. I was a little bit disappointed with the drink menu. With the amount of sweet, fruity drinks they specialize in one would think that they might cater exclusively to Mexican Bachelorette parties. Everything seems to be rum (oh wait - Sammy's Beach Bar Rum), pineapple juice, coconut, and various fruity fillings. Not the manliest drinks.

I liked the quiet atmosphere (judging by previous reviews this seems to be a rarity here) and the food was good. Expensive, but good. There's no sense complaining about expense when you're in a place founded by a celebrity and it's on the Las Vegas Strip. Ni modo, así es la vida.

This is three stars for me personally. Four for the location and two for the food. It just was not my taste. I ordered the carne asada nachos. Next time I would not pay extra for the meat and just go with the beans on the nachos. My date had tortilla soup. It was very dark broth. He said it was okay but he was eating it because he ordered it not because he wanted it. Our waiter was great and very attentive. I wish I remembered his name to give him credit.
Excellent great tasting food, great atmosphere. Indoor and outdoor seating.  Lots of tv's. Great service.

My first experience with Cabo Wabo was purchasing a 32 oz. frozen margarita of my choice.

WARNING may get a little intoxicated.

My family and I were trying to decide where to eat for dinner and the decision was made to dine at Cabo Wabo. They have two separate host stations, one for outside seating and one for inside seating. The patio was going to take about a half hour wait so we decided to dine indoors. The had us wait for a few minutes to get our table set up. Once we were sat, we were greeted by a very friendly server, I believe her name was Sarah. Sarah was helpful, patient, and kind. She offered us suggestions and was very attentive. Sarah is exceptional.

One of Sarah's suggestions for a beverage was the MARGARITA VERDE [Cabo Wabo tequila, lime, freshly minced cucumber & cilantro, served on the rocks]. We ordered a pitcher $44 which serves about four full glasses; delicious and refreshing! For my dinner, I decided on the GRILLED PORTABELLA MUSHROOM FAJITAS [fajitas vegetable, guacamole, pico do gallo, sour cream & flour tortillas] $25.95 (for one); I had it served over melted cheeses skillet add $3.00 and a side of rice. The food was flavorful and well presented. My only negative critique is, not enough tortillas; you only receive three but an additional two would be better but that's a personal preference.

The music was really loud. it was hard to converse with my family or listen to Sarah, our server. Over all, my experience was exceptional and I definitely recommend dining at Cabo Wabo the next time you're in Las Vegas!

They don't even deserve one star. On the busiest day for Mexican Restaurants they failed to provide basic service. They sat us, a table of 9 at a table and got our order of drinks in. We then proceeded to wait an hour and a half until one of us went to the bar tender to get someone to take our order. We needed to leave on time so we asked for our check to come in early and prearranged hat it be separate. The bill came but not separate and before we had even received our food. The food finally came and we still had no silverware. They comped us chips and salsa for 2 hours of horrible service, due to lack of staff.

I'm from LA, so I know good Mexican food when I taste it... and this isn't it. Is it horrible? No, but nothing remarkable that's for sure. And the service? Horrible. 

Let's start from the beginning. Our party of four was crammed at a tiny table with tons of foot traffic. Some girl came over to take our order... not sure who she was, as she made it a point to tell us she was NOT our server but was going to be taking our order. Clearly she wasn't happy at being told to help out our actual server, as she was rude, surly, uninterested and completely unhelpful. 

When ordering, I said to her, "How are the short rib enchiladas?" I got a blank stare and she replied, "they're good" in such a way that I began to question my order and said, "I'm not hearing any enthusiasm... should I order something else?" She robotically replied with a sigh and said that she's never had them, but they are popular there. Um ok. 

Then, my friend who is a vegetarian, was told by the people at the front that almost everything on the menu could be modified into a vegetarian dish. (I mean, it's really not that difficult. Take any freaking dish and omit the meat and voila!) Rude girl taking our order: "WHO told you that?!!" and rolled her eyes and put her hands defiantly on her hips. Then she added, "The ONLY vegetarian options are a cheese quesadilla or a salad!" After being told what was said at the front, my friend asked if she could order cheese enchiladas with avocado and was told "Oh, I guess you could do that." When our food came, no cheese enchiladas... but instead, a cheese quesadilla. ((SIGH)). The food runner was just as rude. My friend made the comment that it wasn't what she ordered but she'd eat it anyway. The runner insisted on getting the enchiladas as she barked, "BECAUSE WE WANT YOU TO BE HAPPY!" Lol.

And during the long period of time we were waiting for our food, I flagged down a server and asked for some chips and salsa. And as if this place didn't suck already, I was told they CHARGE for chips and salsa! What?!! Come again?? Never, ever in my life have I been to a Mexican restaurant (and I've been in a LOT in my time) and been charged for chips and salsa. I mean, I know we are in the price gouging capital of the world, Las Vegas, where dumb tourists will fork out any kind of money not knowing any better, but it will be a cold day in hell before I pay $5 bucks for chips and salsa. One week later, I'm still shaking my head as I write this.

Other than that, we never saw our server again... never checked on us, refilled water, nothing. The food was unremarkable. Average, at best. The mango picante margarita was pretty decent... took forever to arrive but tasted good. I was about 85% thru my meal when someone over my shoulder tried to take my plate away (wtf). And then for the remainder of our meal, there was a staff member table stalking us to fill our table the second we stood up, which was uncomfortable and we felt rushed (even though the service on their end was slow). 

Summary: Disappointed.

While some people would consider Cabo Wabo noisy, I thought it added to the ambiance and gave the place an electrifying atmosphere.  The food choices are plentiful, but the food itself is generally unimpressive.  For a Mexican restaurant not to have black beans, refried beans nor ground beef is inexcusable.  The server, Adam F., was excellent and helpful.  Overall, a nice experience, but one that can be beat food-wise.

My original review was flagged & removed by the moral police @ Yelp because I was too honest. I apparently included "personal attacks" by naming names at this God awful restaurant. I still, however want to put in my 2 cents about it. 

We had a $60 groupon that was apparently only able to be used by a party of 4 or more. This was written in the tiny print online only-nowhere printed on the groupon. The "manager" on duty was an ass. He immediately said he was going up to his office in order to print something out to prove us wrong. He was VERY condescending, attacking and just an all around awful person. The GM, who was not much better, cam down to us and finally agreed to take the $30 off that we paid for the groupon. The waitress was great and. Feel bad that she has to work for these nimrods. She had no clue that there was a per party requirement either, which again speaks to the (lack of) skill of these brilliant managers. 

I threw a fit with Groupon and got my money back. The chick on the phone did not sound surprised. Also-there were other tables having similar issues with their Groupons. 

Regardless-I'll never ever go back.
Great atmosphere, but food and drinks are just ok. I had the carne asada tacos,sangarita, and can't drive 55. The patio is perfect for people watching

Place is super expensive. At $20 a plate they can at least bring some chips without charging extra. 

It's loud and big. If you can't get a patio seat consider just pushing on. 

However, the tortilla soup is amazing. The service was excellent. 

Fish tacos had great presentation and texture but low on flavor. Nachos were standard. 

I rated it 3 considering the price.

I came to Cabo Wabo to use a Groupon ($30 worth of food for $15) and because, frankly, I was intrigued by the schizophrenic Yelp reviews for the place. I had an early lunch around 11:30 am on a Wednesday and sat outside to watch people walk by on the Strip.

I had a pretty good experience at Cabo Wabo. The Cactus Pear Margarita was surprisingly tasty, and I'm not always a big fan of margs. I had the guacamole (not as great as some were saying, but pretty decent) and the jalapeno cilantro chicken. Nothing was spectacular, but nothing was terrible either.

To me, the big downer on Cabo Wabo is the price. But come on, it's right on the Las Vegas Strip - what do you expect? My drink, guac, and entree came to $34, so I used up my Groupon and then some. Between the price of the Groupon and the amount I paid in tax/tip, the whole experience ran me around $26. Without the Groupon it would have been $41, which seems awfully high for one person. However, Cabo Wabo does have a happy hour from 4-7 pm with half-price drinks and appetizers. I'd imagine that would be worth your time - if you can get a seat.

Went there with my friend and her SERVICE ANIMAL and got asked for service animal papers by the hostess . After telling her we don't have it as the law doesn't require it she became very rude about it. 

Needless to say we left

Perhaps, the staff should have been trained what to do when a customer walks in with a dog, or at least use a common sense.

Horrible food and service in outdoor patio! Really weird because we were here a couple years ago. Back then the food was better. Now you get tasteless tacos with canned beans and premade rice, gross! I've had better food at cafeterias! Took me 10 minutes to get my waiters attention just to try to get some hot sauce! Will never return here in Las Vegas again! HORRIBLE!

I ordered a taco salad and was surprised by how huge the portion was. It's a typical taco salad tossed with shredded nachos, Chedder cheese, and guacamole..nothing extraordinary. But if you're looking for a quick, non-fast food and inexpensive place to eat by the Strip, this would be a good place to stop by.
Mark & Christy best bartenders ever. They were way fun & made our day @ Cani wabo ! Thank you !

No.

Obviously you don't have very high expectations when going to a place like this.. it's basically a glorified bar.. and this location is on the Las Vegas Strip...and to basically mimic what another reviewer said: the service was sloooow - and the food was GROSS. 

I ordered a 'chicken fajita burrito'.. which came to he table as a 'BEEF fajita burrito'.. about 35 minutes after it was ordered..AND it had CHILI all over it... like beef chili.. slopped over the top.. along with fake canned cheese.. which I guess would be fine, if that is what I had ordered.. and i was extremely drunk.  It was incorrect.. it looked unappealing.. but hey, I gave it a chance. Sufficed to say, I won't be going back for that particular menu item. (I did mention to the server that it was incorrect... he claimed they sent the wrong one, and I said I would deal with it.. but on the bill, it was listed as BEEF Fajita Burrito..as in.. he ordered the wrong item and lied to me about it.) Mistakes happen.. I get it... I'm just sayin.

The 2 friends I was with, both decided it was pretty bad service as there were missing utensils, drinks for the 3 of us were coming one at a time.. and there really seemed to be no excuse for the lack in service, because they were not at all busy.   We all agreed that the drinks weren't bad.. and the outdoor patio is a nice attraction to ''people watch' from .. but other than that.. I will not be eating any of their "signature" dishes again...ever. They had chicken tenders with fries on the menu, and if I ever visit this spot again to have drinks.. and decide that I am hungry (and very lazy, because there are 10 better choices less than 50 feet away, ) I will be having those. 

I don't recommend the food at all. The drinks were good and the Jeremiah Sweet Tea Vodka(?) Drink.. was tasty albeit very  sweet... but I did have 2! Anyway.. that's that.. good luck in your dining adventures!

Despite the name, a bit expensive and mediocre, but well located on a busy section of the Strip.  Come here so you can sit outside on the large deck, otherwise it's not worth seeking out.

Despite the proudly featured margarita ads and the house tequila being top-shelf Cabo Wabo, they had no drink list, and minimally described only 3 tequila-based drinks (which are available frozen, mentioned first).  They seemed much more interested in selling us beer.

Tortilla soup was decently spiced, but a little too salty and a little too thick.

Service was attentive to a fault (checking in with us every 5ish minutes).

The location, however, is quite awesome-- at a major crosswalk, across the street from new Aria, with a view of the booming fountains at Bellagio.  Good for taking in the strip while having a drink, if you sit outside.  They have some gas heaters on the deck for the winter, but this sort doesn't seem to give off much heat.  Doesn't seem like there'd be a view from inside.

I've been to the original Cabo Wabo Cantina in Los Cabos, which has better pricing, drink specials, and much much more atmosphere, if much less of a view.

I was not impress with the food at Cabo Wabo Cantina Las Vegas . I went there with my friend, because we were super hungry and we were craving Mexican food. 
The portions are small and they are very, very pricy. 
We spend over $60 for 2 plates. 
Our waiter was nice, but still it wasn't worth it. I can get the same meal for $20 some where else.

My group, ten in all, found that all of our drinks seemed absent of alcohol.  This caused several of us to watch the bartenders pour, ultimately a waste of good money.  The overhead heaters close proximity to patrons was a concern, virtually cooking us all.  

Overall, the service was subpar.  The waiter treated us as if he was bothered with providing service and stated as a matter of fact that the tip will be no less than 18%.
The food is excellent, so are the waiters. Patio is usually crowded, but you can also eat inside. The patio is fun though because there is so much fun going on outside.
The ghost of Sammy Hagar is ever present. Oh wait, he is still alive. She maybe it is just the essence if Sammy. Eau d'Sammy

My husband and I decided to play "tourist" on the Memorial Day weekend.  We started to Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops.  While walking thru the shops, we decided to share a yard margarita.  (If we wanted to play tourists, we had to look the part!)  Fat Tuesdays had a line down the hall and around the corner!  So we thought we'd see what else was in the shops.  We thought we were lucky because just as we were about to walk out of the shops, Cabo Wabo Cantina appears with a margarita/daiquiri stand.  We end up getting the  1/2 yard with a strawberry margarita.  The first couple sips, neither of us said anything.  I didn't care for the drink so I stopped drinking it.  About 2 minutes later, my husband looks at me and says "Doesn't this taste a little funny?"   Yes!  It tasted like a watered down slushie/virgin margarita!  We decided to salvage the drink...went to ABC Store, bought Bacardi's Cherry flavor and poured a couple shots in there.  It tasted much better after that.  All and all...the drink cost over $30 (between the cost of the  1/2 yard at Cabo Wabo, tip, and ABC liquor purchase).  Will we go back?  Heck NO!  I'll wait in line at Fat Tuesdays or skip the drink next time.

PS:  This struck me as very strange....Our server at Cabo Wabo was counting her tips.  And not just quickly going thru the cash and then waiting on us.  She was pretending to be interested in us while she was counting out her money.  We told her our drink order and she gave us the "deer in the headlights" look with a blank smile!  She wasn't paying attention to one word we said!  We repeated our order, she recounted her money then got us our drink.  Not sure why it was so important to count her money so intensely but it was kinda weird!

See Photo for Tequila Recommendation.

Came here twice this last year.  Location is nice.  

1st time: Food/Service for the food.....Not really that great.  I tried to eat here and left because the service was lacking.  Waters were not filled.  Food came cold and without condiments we needed like salsa and when we asked for it, the server forgot about us. 

2nd Time: They earned an extra star because of Groupon. They had a special for $15 for $30 worth of food or drinks. The best part was that for some reason Groupon only charged $1! I was like What??? I don't care how bad, the place was before...Dollar for drinks? I'm in. I purchased 2!  

Apparently it was some mistake, but Groupon honored it and I came armed with $30 to spend.  Went straight to the bar and got two $14 shots of tequila that came in a Worm shaped  bottle.

Smooooooooth. So if you come armed with the Groupon or not get the Tequila in the Worm Bottle. You will not regret it. Skip the food.  Hagar earned the extra star for the Worm Bottle Tequila Basically and the nice bartender.  Didn't have time to use the other Groupon on that trip...but Worm Tequila...I'm coming back for you!!!

It's a chain with relativity poor yelp reviews,
I usually don't even consider these types of places.  However my girlfriend likes to makes fun of me solely basing my selections on yelp reviews and I hate to admit it but she's right.  Cabo is the places she'll always remind l hey you said it had bad reviews but you liked it", then I'll have to dip my head and go yeah your right.   It's good, I've never had a bad meal and the margaritas are really good, like really good.   It's a prime spot for people watching, good music and sometimes they have live bands .

What a wonderful experience we had in this restaurant, first my server Mario on top of everything,then jesus running the food and asking if we need something else,then Yesenia with her wonderful customer service,Jazmine did such an amazing job too,great teamwork guys just keep doing what you are doing,because you are doing amazing job.THANKS YESENIA,MARIO,JESUS,JAZMINE

This is one of our favorite places to eat when we are in Vegas. We love the Bloody Mary's and grilled chicken nachos. Great food and great service. Will always go back!!!  Went 3 times on our past trip to Vegas! Still great!!!!

I went back for lunch and up'ed my rating to a 5. Why? Because the steak & shrimp fajitas were amazingly delicious.  We got a pitcher of their regular margarita which was very good.

Great spot to eat, drink, people watch, and listen to good music.  They had a DJ in the afternoon.   Will definitely be back here soon.

worst food ever. Even my boyfriend who will eat just about anything- did not finish his food. 
I paid $11 for a taco and enchilada, I ate perhaps two bites of taco and a third of my enchilada. NEVER again. Why does this place continue to get business?

They don't honor the groupon that is out. I bought one of the $15 for $30 food and drinks. All they would give me is the $15 I originally paid. Don't buy the groupon, and you should not dine at a restaurant that pulls stuff like that. My server was decent and understanding of my situation.

Slushees in Vegas because who likes water? 
    Vegas slushees no matter where you go it's a must to get an extra shot. It was a nice place the girls at the front counter where awesome. You get to try a sample of all the flavors but it is recommended to mix them. 
     The drink itself kind of reminds you of a wine cooler with ice. So the collector cup is with the slushee is 24 and the extra shot makes it 29. 
      So I preferred the tacos and Rita's at the mgm had a groupon for a buy one get one. Way worth it to add  an extra shot on that and I definitely could taste the alcohol which is the whole point in buying the drink. 
     You end up throwing the big giant cup away when your finished because who has room for that in there luggage. 
     Might be a better option to buy a small one. 
So as far as the workers they were great and this place is pretty hip and trendy with outdoor seating across from the bellagio fountains.

BOMB FOOD! Omggggg let me tell you. Get the appetizer sampler with a beer of your choice and you won't be sorry! Everything was so delicious. We sat outside on the patio and had a front view of the Bellagio fountains. The sampler came with wings (most amazing sauce on them) quesadillas, taquitos, fries, and other things that I can't remember. Wish I took a picture. The guacamole was so creamy and fresh. The hot sauce (house made) was to die for. Perfect spice. Washed down with a cold beer... with a view... what is better??? I would def return here. Loved the ambiance and our server was the sweetest!!!
I waiting 35 minutes to get a drink!, WTF, the waitress was complete lost I ask for another beer and she bring me the check lol, food was ok a little salt but was good.

Visiting on vacation and saw this cool outdoor Mexican place and thought I had to go. Went here with my bf and we sat on the ledge where you can people watch all the people walking by in Vegas.  The weather also wasn't too bad, great atmosphere.  Our waiter was nice and friendly.  I ordered the appetizer sampler and it was great! I loved everything on that plate.  My bf got shrimp tacos, and these were the first shrimp tacos I've tasted that actually weren't bland.  If I visit again, I will be returning!

On my first trip to Vegas we decided to grab a bite to eat. Walking the strip we came across Cabo Wabo Cantina. It was packed, so we decided to see if there would be a wait. They girl said she would be able to seat our party ASAP. We approached the table and it WAS dirty, the girl quickly bused it though and had it wiped down. We decided to get a pitcher of the desert pear margarita. There was enough in the pitcher for two drinks each for the three ppl we had. It was pretty good but I didn't taste the desert pear really. I ordered steak fajitas while the other two in my party got a chimichanga and vegetarian fajitas (portobello mushrooms). The fajitas said they came with flour tortillas and the sever said he was willing to honor my request for corn. We also got chips and salsa for the table. While most of the food was in the $15-$30 range, Chips and salsa were $4! It was a huge serving and was very good! Our food came pretty quickly. The amount of food I had was enough for two ppl actually. I had enough left over to take back to the hotel to eat the next day. My meat was cooked and seasoned perfectly! I was a little disappointed that I only received three tortillas. Being Latina, I LOVE tortillas, so I wish I was given more. All in all, I enjoyed my meal and appreciated the prompt service and that our server was very helpful and attentive! I will definitely return!

Great place for good food & great drinks! The CW margarita was so good! I ordered the lobster enchiladas they were ok I probably wouldn't order them again though. I think the drinks are way better than their food. Also the music they play is great! Makes ya wanna get up & dance! We like going here for a chill experience which you will get!

Great view of the water show at the Bellagio Hotel. The food was good and they had live music. It's a good spot for a quick lunch while you walk the strip. Good place to people watch and enjoy your surrounding atmosphere.

We came in for a quick bite to eat before leaving Vegas sat outside and ordered a strawberry Margarita, it was so sweet you can barely drink it.
We also ordered the nachos and chicken wings the nachos were very good I font know about the chicken wings cause my wife had one wing and noticed a hair in her plate and lost her appetite we sent it back they were kind enough to take it off our bill needless to say it was not the Mexican food we are used to here in southern Cali would I go back to Vegas of corse to wabo Cabo don't think so

My husband and I went here the day after our wedding and it was super busy for lunch. The service was terrible. Also this place gave my husband food poisoning and he spent the rest of our honeymoon in the bathroom and ruined our trip. He ordered the chicken tacos. I tell everyone that goes to vegas to avoid this place at all costs.

It is not my first time here, nor I have personal feelings towards this place. 

HOWEVER, Anthony was probably one of the worst server I have had in any service industry. I really did not want to mention his name, because it would ruin his day once he reads this review; however, I thought he might be better off knowing why this review had to be written. 

The hostess promptly took us to the patio seating on a Thursday night. Anthony did not approach to our table for about 10 minutes. Once he came, we were not really sure what we wanted, but he seemed to just want to rush us. He never greeted us, nor smiled. He just gave me an impression that we were not welcomed at all. 

Then, we ordered a pitcher of margarita, chicken taquitos and carnitas tacos. A food runner brought out the food. We asked for napkins to this guy, and he never brought us. We ended up asking our server, Anthony, and he actually brought us the napkins and hot sauce right away- which was one good thing he did for us. Then, we were eating and chilling there. We were about done with our food and drinks, deciding whether we were going to order more or not; however, Anthony approached to our table, and without saying a single word, he started taking away all plates and cleaning up our table. HORRIBLE. We are literally thinking what to order next, and he just decides to make us a reason to get out. 

We just ended up getting out of the restaurant. I know strip food can suck, but the only reason why a local resident would come out to the strip and pay extra money for bad food is because they got nice ambiance and proper service; however, Anthony did not even get the basics right. I would never go back to this spot, just because they have failed me so bad last night.
Great place for food and drink.  Large portions.  Good variety.  Outside patio seating provides ringside seatimg to the Strip.  Lively.  Our thanks to Katie for her efficient, kind service.

First time last weekend! We were seated quickly and our server was nice and had a great sense of humor. Food was okay I just felt like everything was overpriced for what it was. Drinks were good though!

It's chain-restaurant Mexican food a la Chili's.  What do you expect?!  It's Sammy freaking Hagar!
That being said, first I had to walk about 10 miles from the parking garage to the restaurant (I hate Planet Hollywood!).  Then I paid $40 for a house margarita, a shot of Patron and a plate of "fajita nachos" that were just Eh.  I was there on a rainy Monday night, so can't really speak for the atmo -- it was dead.  I'm sure if it had been nice out, sitting on the Strip-side patio would have at least been good people watching!
Over-priced disgusting food. I was not expecting authentic Mexican food from this place but something decent. We didn't finish out food.
Decent cheap eats, though they upsell like crazy, and push for basics (that are add ons).

Had a Waborita and a Can't Drive and tacos. Sitting outside on the patio was a great decision, the atmosphere is fun.
The live musician was a talented singer and guitarist, and he played a lot of great songs which made us want to stick around longer.

Matches up to the most of the reviews.  Drinks are good, Food is a simulacrum of the named dish. 

It's a one time mistake:)

Our first night in Vegas and we needed somewhere to eat that wasn't too far from our hotel. We were seated outside immediately and each ordered a drink. It was a cold night so we were glad they had heaters nearby. There was live rock music that night so we basically got dinner and a show! I ordered the green veggie burrito and my husband ordered the Asada tacos. He was very happy with his tacos but wished there was a larger portion. What he got was only fit for an appetizer! Our bill came out to be a bit pricier than we anticipated but I am sure that it being in the strip in a Vegas is going to drive up the cost. Service was good and the music was entertaining so we can't complain much!
I've been here 2 times. Both for breakfast on the patio. I'm a nacho kind of guy so chicken chilequiles or huevos de nachos are perfect. Great place to people watch also.
Andre 3000 is freaking amazing. Cabo Wabo offers top 1 quesadillas, top 1 mimosas, top 1 mango margaritas and top 1 customer service. Andre was freaking amazing!!!!!!
The BEST place to get a drink and people watch in Vegas! Great casual atmosphere, reasonably priced items ($24 for a pitcher of beer) and great music.

We tried this place about 2 years ago for dinner and I recalled the food was pretty good so this trip we stopped there for lunch. The location is awesome, with a great view of the Bellagio fountains which our daughter loves. So we get there and I ask the hostess if we could get a seat outside in the front. She doesn't smile, isn't pleasant one bit and asks, well, are you going to be eating?  Um, what do you think we came here to just sit at lunchtime?  She stands there looking puzzled for about 20 seconds, then finally took us to the seats without saying anything.  The waiter was cool but man, the food sucked - I had burrito and hubby had combo plate.  He asks for spicier salsa... we charge extra for that... jalapenos?  we charge extra for that.... really? You're charging 14 bucks for a burrito and you can't throw us some lousy jalapenos??  Never coming here again that's for sure... terrible hostess, terrible food at high prices.

A group of about 10 of us came here for breakfast/lunch on our first full day in Vegas.  We had good and friendly service.  Quite a few of us ordered the frozen $20 margaritas... Sweet and delicious!  We got our chips and salsa quickly which were pretty good.  I ordered the $10 combo plate with one chicken taco and one chicken enchilada which came with rice and beans.  The food was pretty good, though I could have used some hot sauce.  Overall, it was a good experience.

We were excited to visit this place, so we decided to meet friends here. We did not eat here. We only went there for drinks. The service was AWFUL! It took 20 minutes to get someone to wait on us. We only were helped after we stopped two different servers. The first server looked at me and said "wait a minute" and never came back. I will not be returning here.

The front desk girl took our name and said it would be 10 mins, she suggested we wait at the bar. 45 minutes later and 4 margaraitas later, we noticed so many more people were being seated. As I walked up to her to see what the deal was, she said she was just coming to get us. Yeah right. Anyway, our waitress was great. Food was typical American Mexican....tacos, burritos, etc. Nothing too fancy, and nothing worth noting here. We were in a hurry so we chose this place on a whim...we will plan better next time.

Super expensive 
No flavor on the food 
You paying for the view of the bellagio 
Not worth it

Server was cool.  Good customer service from his end, which is the only reason this spot got 2 stars.

Ceviche tasted not so good.  Nachos were OK.

N ow let's talk about the performer (deep eye roll).  He's sitting there playing a guitar and singing, wanting audience participation.  I think a lot more people would have been enthusiastic had this idiot not racially profiled a table with some Asian folks.  His first question to them was "do you speak english?"  Seriously... he made it that much worse by making lite of his comment, and acknowledging that he racially profile.  Disgusting!!!   He wanted them to move out that table cause.... well who knows why, he just did.  However the next set of folks that say there, he didn't ask them about the language they spoke, nor did he ask them to leave.  

I hope others read this and make an effort not to support this place until they get rid of this bigot

Okay where do I start I visited this location visiting from California after visiting me & 2 others were sick I contacted the location admittedly the following day that was on Sunday they are just now calling me back this after noon after me calling again this morning Jason the manager was very unprofessional & disrespectful & hung up in my face multiple times including the assistant manager not knowing I'm a business owner myself & visit Vegas very often so with that being said I called again yet to get anywhere with this issue so I'm going to contact customer service if I can which Jason would not provide me with ether deal with this issue or get a law suit against your ASS IM NOT TO BE PLAYED WITH PERIOD YOU KNOW HOW TO REACH ME

If I really had to, I guess I will come back to Cabo Wabo. But given this is Vegas, Thank You because there are better places around. 

To start off, we ask to be seated by the heater and where did we get seated... not near the heater. Uhhh, did you not hear us?!  It was a cold Saturday night so when we saw open space by the heater, we decided to scoot our table ourselves. 

I ordered the mushroom fajitas plate- I wouldn't recommend it. Partly my fault because after ordering it I realized how delicious can mushroom fajitas be?! And partly because the mushrooms were flavorless. It was not marinated and grilled that well. 

If I'm ever back, I'll head straight to the bar instead.!

Only got a strawberry lemonade here while others in my party got food. The burgers looked phenomenal. I regret not going back to get one for myself. Great atmosphere. Great spot to people watch on the strip.

Well we came by for lunch today and I wete pleasantly !! First they say us right away and the server was excellent and very attentive. My wife had the Cobb salad and I had the tacos . I must say we were both happy with our meals also the salsa that comes with the chips was delicious. Our server explained the breakfast menu and was very detailed on what to expect if we came back for breakfast. Great ambience and decor we really enjoyed the lunch experience and we would come back and recommend anyone looking for a good lunch spot in LV to come and visit.

I have a feeling I would've liked this place better before I stopped drinking; oh well.  Ended up grabbing lunch inside as it was a windy day.  Bottom line, food was really pretty good, no complaints amongst the group and I liked my Carne Asada Burrito well enough.  It's Vegas and on the strip so it's overpriced and all, but that's to be expected.  What one shouldn't have to settle for is poor or slow service.  Lunch took well over an hour, about 2/3 of which passed after our food arrived; the waiter just disappeared.   Additionally, they seated us at the table in front of the door to the deck, which would've been find except that remember we sat INSIDE becasue of the wind.  So every time they opened the door, it would slam back against the wall and the rush of wind would blow everything off the table, Took 3-4 instances of this and a few parties complaining before they figured out not to use that door and divert to a door closer to the bar.  Better values and equally good food to be had in the Miracle Mile if you find yourself at PH.

Also, although I am not a drinker, I did use the free Maragarita with a Yelp check in to score a drink for my buddy.  This seemed to confuse both the server and the manager ( the Yelp coupon, not the Margarita). Seems like it would be a good idea to  make sure your employees know your offers on social media!

Atmosphere was really cool - almost felt like we were in Mexico! They were very very busy and our server was nice. 
The portions are kind of on the small side. Hubby got the huevos rancheros (smallest I have ever seen) and I got the breakfast burrito. There wasn't  a lot of flavor to either of them so  we added some hot sauce, and ordered Guac and salsa. The Guac didn't have much flavor either but the salsa was great. 

They also gave us a free house  margarita because we unlocked it on yelp but it was warm!! Blah!

Horrible.

Went to watch a UFC fight this past weekend, do NOT waste your time. Yes, it was cheaper than other places, but it was not worth it. I was told i was going to get a table and when i came back to check on my table i was told there was only standing room. They allowed way too many people in. People were sitting on the stairs and standing everywhere! Including in my way.

The food was awful. It tasted like a tv dinner mexican food. 

And on top of all this, i almost got smacked in the head by bus boys bringing in tables and chairs for all the extra people they let in.

The plus side? the waitress was really nice.

Do I have to put a star?  Super over priced. Garbage do yourself a favor. Go to lindo michoacan if you want Mexican food. Best thing about cabo wabo is the name! Can't believe such a good name can be dragged threw the dirt like this place.
We had a great time sitting outside and enjoying the music.  The food was great, especially the chile relleno special. Chips and salsa were worth it also!  Thanks Morgan for the service.
Caesar and Wendell are an awesome team! We had a great time here. The cilantro jalapeño chicken is amazing! My husband and I live in so cal but we come to Vegas often. This place is amazing.

It's a chain. Tastes like chain. Server was friendly. Prices were reasonable if you go in knowing what you're gonna get. Love the check in Rita ( which was stronger than the specialty drink I had). Try to get a seat by the ledge so you can people watch. We went after dark whole folks were heading to the clubs and that was the best entertainment of the night!

Ehh, I always pass this place & was never tempted to try. So me & hubby go to a Comedy Show at the V theater with some friends, & we were starving after. We walked around 10- almost 11pm & one of our friends pointed this place out. I asked if we can keep walking to find a better place but we were too famished we just had to stop. Very depressing it had to be this place. If you're hungry & walk by, keep going. There are better places to eat and drink in this desert. Drinks were decent, service was terrible, food was worse. We all took a few bites & left the food at the table. For the price you pay, this place needs to be ashamed. Don't even think about it, just skip this dump!!!

I certainly fell in love with the food here! We went for breakfast and I got french toast croissant and hubby got a 3 cheese omlet with chorizo. But were delicious! I LOVED the potatoes! I ate more of hubbys food but it was all yummy!

Originally my friend and I were craving burgers and fries and didn't feel like walking inside Planet Hollywood to look for Gordon Ramsey burgers. 
She spotted Cabo Wabo Cantina outside of Planet Hollywood, across from where we were standing in front of the Cosmopolitan. 

We head over to Cabo Wabo we were immediately seated on the patio facing the strip (choice of indoor or outdoor seating). We enjoyed people watching, some in their costumes collecting tips for a pic. Some were very creative like Olaf whom looked like a Cholaf, a Mickey Mouse regect, 2 minions and a couple Egyptian guys. 

Our server comes by and takes our order. I ordered the carne asada plate and my friend orders the carnitas burritos. While waiting we're snap chatting away and I check in on YELP --- 1 FREE MARGARITA woot woot!
Then 2 old men get seated next to us - and they were the same old men that wanted to take photos with us when we were at Bellagio. LOL it was funny... we should have gotten a tip for pic.

Any ways, our food arrives and we killed it!! Not cz we were super  hungry cz it was delicious!!! Yummm... the rice, beans and carne asada (3) were just perfect. I've started to appreciate avocados and my carne asada tacos had a slice on each one... made me super happy!

They had a live band playing behind us (more like a solo band). He was really good. He played his guitar maybe it was a Ukele and he was singing live robin thicke, Bruno mars, flo-rida, etc. He sang his version of the songs added a hint of Hawaiian island beat to it. I loved it! 

Our server was ok ((less the one star)) She was nice to my friend and I but rude to the old guys sitting next to us. They would call her and say "excuse me, excuse me" she looks at them and keeps walking. RUDE! I felt so bad cz all he wanted was a cup of coffee. - Maybe cz he was smoking in the patio and no smoking was allowed. He probably didn't know, there wasn't a sign or anything. 

Well this place is good for entertainment, food was good, vibe was great!

I loved this place! They have super fun frozen drinks and there wasn't much of a wait at all if you are willing to sit inside.

I had the Ahi tuna burrito, it was absolutely delicious. I was with four friends and they all really loved their food too. One got shrimp fajitas and it came with a ton of shrimp!! 

The only reason I am only giving them three stars is because our waiter was AWFUL. He wasn't friendly at all and made us feel like we were inconveniencing him when we asked for anything. 

I get that most of the people that go in are tourists so they don't need to be friendly to ensure repeat business but a little smile goes a long way.

Overall, the food and margaritas are totally worth putting up with the crappy service.

Stopped by for a quick dinner and drinks and Aia made all of the difference. She was supper up beat and helped us navigate the menu and what she recommended for all of us was great.  Come by and say hello and watch the scenery.

I had the Short-Rib Enchiladas and my wife had the Beef Tacos. The meat was seasoned very well and the meat was tender. Both of our plates came with beans and rice, which were both flavored nicely. The Drinks are very potent so beware. We are from New Mexico and we know flavor, so Cabo Wabo Cantina food passes our taste test. Servers are attentive and gracious. Will definitely return next time we are back in Vegas.

We stopped here for a quick snack and a margarita...and were pretty underwhelmed.

We sat outside on the patio in the bar area, and our server was friendly, but the overall atmosphere was not what we expected.  The bar area itself was pretty unkempt with used glasses and half-eaten baskets of chips strewn about, but our table itself was not that dirty.  The flatware and appetizer plates, however, matched the decor of the bar and we had to ask for new sets twice before settling on some that we could use.  

We both had a regular margarita made with Patron silver on the rocks, and while they were not overly sweet, the taste of tequila was pretty negligible.  Since it was hot out, they still tasted good, but not good enough to order more than one.  After getting our drinks, we tried an order of the Chips, Salsa & Guacamole from the appetizer menu, and an order of the ceviche.  The guac was pretty good (but lacked salt), and we liked the salsa, but the seafood in the ceviche was definitely not "cooked" all the way.  I would say stick to the easy to prepare items on the menu as far as food goes (the ceviche should be a hard pass), as the focus seems to be more on quantity and not quality.

Also worth noting is that when we asked for our check, our friendly server suddenly turned into our SLOW server, and it took more than 15 minutes for her to just run our card.  I would recommend paying with cash if you can, as it seemed like a few other tables around us were riding on the same train of frustration when it came time to pay.

Overall, there are better spots to grab a quick drink and a good bite to eat, but if you do stop in here, try the inside dining area for a more enjoyable dining experience.

Cheers!

Went here after seeing a show at planet hollywood and the atmosphere is upbeat with music and people but the food is just ok. We ordered carnitas tacos, carne asada tacos, chicken enchiladas, lobster enchiladas and as an appetizer we got the rolled chicken taocs. For all 4 of us we weren't impressed with anything but it wasn't terrible either.
We had the most wonderful experience here. The view and the food were both fantastic. The service was excellent and I have 0 complaints about our time here.

This is a perfect spot for hangover food especially if you stay at the Cosmo.
Good food, big portions, great service, it's a win win. Not pricey at all.

I decided to take my wife to @CaboWaboLV for an early Valentine's dinner since she is the biggest @Sammy_Hagar fan & has been dying to check this place out since it opened. 

Before going I did my homework and read all the reviews that had been posted. After reading I was really surprised this place is still OPEN. Not too many good things being said. 

We arrived on Friday night around 10pm and the house band had just started playing. Acoustic Soul-Las Vegas' Original & Only LIVE Jukebox. They play all requests-some good some NOT so good. 

We were seated immediately with no wait even though the place was packed including the outdoor patio bar. 

The menu is mexican food with a baja twist. VERY Pricey. We ordered Beef Fajita Nachos to start-The Carne Asada Entree & a 3 item combo with Hard & Soft shell tacos and a cheese enchilada. Ice Water all around. NO drinks this time:) 

(However they did pour FREE shots of tequila when the band played "Mas' Tequila") 

The service was a little slow it took nearly 30 minutes before we saw the appetizers and we spent most of the night chewing on ice. 

The nachos were very underwhelming-10-12 soggy chips covered in cheap shredded cheese and sparse bits of beef fajita meat. 4 melonballer size scoops of (lettuce,pico,sour cream & guac) NO seasoning, no spice, no flavor just cheese. The complimentary chips & salsa are a much better choice. 

NEXT, the entrees came out- The carne asada plate covered w/cheese, onions and jalapenos. a couple tortillas and a plate with (lettuce,pico,sour cream & guac). NO salsa!! Again with the cheap shredded cheese and the jalapenos were not even cooked just sliced and covered in cheese. 

The fajita onions & peppers were way too much compared to the skimpy 8oz carne asada steak. The steak like the nachos had NO seasoning or flavor. FOR $20 at a bar I was really expecting something phenomenal. 

The 3 item combo of beef tacos and cheese enchilada was alright except for the cheese enchilada which again used the cheap shredded cheese which didnt melt well at all and was tasteless. 


The lack of seasoning for a mexican resataurant is really unacceptable and NO salsa with entrees no beans with the chips appetizer. :( 


For 2 people to have an appetizer and 2 entrees-drink ice water and get slow service for $65 pretty disappointing to say the least:(

Not a terrible place, but not a great place either. I came here with my sister who came a year before and said "don't expect much from the food but they have strong margaritas" Well I hate margaritas but i ordered one anyway because, well, I'm in Vegas. 

The rita was ok, i don't remember the food but it was a nice place, just not my kind of people, we did go back but only because we were staying there and we saw a concert there. the patio was the best part of this place because you can sit over the strip and people watch.

Made a weekend trip out to Vegas for my Best friends birthday and stopped here for a cold beer and appetizer. By far the best choice we made since we have been here. I gave this place 5 stars due to our server Danny. Not only did he provide great customer service but he was very friendly, did a great job of informing us of the specials that weren't on the menu and was just all around very personable. Danny sold us on getting the trio ceviche platter which included ahí tuna, shrimp and red snapper. The best ceviche I've had hands down and the seasoned chips that came with it were amazing. Been to a lot of places to eat and I can honestly say that Danny is the best server we've encountered. It's employees like him that make people want to come back! Great experience!

The food was not that good; I ordered the Chicken Fajitas and chicken was dry, re-fried beans were yuk (canned re-fried beans would have been tastier). Service was okay but our drinks went dry twice before anyone came over to refill. 

Great atmosphere if you have an opportunity to sit out on the patio overlooking the strip. Order the Chips & Salsa and a drink and that would be the best experience of this place.

Seriously amazing service ! My waitress whitney is so much fun! I can't wait to come back! The mimosa was delicious, had the croissant French toast it's to die for ! Seriously Whitney was amazing her and her friends were so much fun !

Normally I'd give this place a 3.5-4 star but today I was snapped at by the server & over charged! We had 2nd drinks on us coupons because Cabo Wabo was closed for a party. They gave these coupons as an I'm sorry. I had 2 margaritas, husband had 2 bud lights. Should've been 1 margarita & 1 beer charged,  1 margarita & 1 beer free... NO!!! They charged me for 2 margaritas=more expensive drinks & gave me the lower priced beers free. How is this 2nd drink on us? We had 2 coupons... this is absolute crap! I do love their outdoor patio over the strip, wish they had live music more often. Food is good but $$$ but then it is ON the strip. Just should've not snapped at me & given me a dirty look then over charged me. Not happy with our visit today AT ALL!

Great place to eat. You get what you pay for. I ordered the Jack and Coke Ribs. Sooo much food. Full Rack of ribs, corn on the cobb and fries for $24. 

They had decent drink specials. But Fat Tuesdays was calling our name.
Amazing food, superior service, fantastic drinks, unique location--had a blast,  will be back!
I love Cabo Wabo! The waitress Aia is so awesome. Very friendly and great at her job! Would definitely come back here. Food is tasty, drinks are strong, and the people watching can't be beat.

We made our first visit to Cabo wabo this past weekend. We were able to get right in and seated quickly. Service was friendly and fast. The food portions are huge. We could have easily shared a meal. My mom ordered the jack and coke ribs (it's a full slab, but they don't tell you!!!) and I ordered the portabello mushroom fajitas. Both entrees were good, but I favored my mom's jack and coke ribs. The ribs were tender and the flavor was phenomenal. The portabello fajitas were good as well. We did not think the prices were outrageous as others have claimed. It's the Las Vegas strip, unless you eat at McDonalds there are not really any "cheap" places to eat.  We did purchase a Groupon but would eat there again without one.
Awesome experience here!  Ask for Ashley T. The service is top notch and very friendly!  If you love people watching, this is your mecca!

Me and my friends visited here from LA and this place on the strip attracted us instantly. We had awesome service and an amazing waitress! Her name was Liz and we had no idea what to order, so she recommended the shrimp cocktail and it was bomb! Exactly what we wanted. She kept us laughing the whole time, and made us feel welcome. I definitely recommend visiting this joint, and asking for Liz because she was the cherry on top of this awesome restaurant!! We will be back!!
Surprisingly great food. I expected it to be overpriced and overhype's but the nachos had outstanding flavor. Great atmosphere.

This place is getting one star for the location and one star for the mediocore chips and salsa. I actually wish I could give half a star for those. A restaraunt usually can't disappoint me when I am starving and hungover but Cabo Wabo managed to do that. Congrats!

For the love of god, please don't come here. The food was so bland and terrible and the service is even more horrid. First off, I am pretty sure our server had tourette's. Not that there is anything wrong with that, I just feel like you should be warned before having to go through that.

I had been walking on the strip for a while before getting to the restaraunt so I was totally parched.  We were seated and no one acknolwedged our presence for 10-15 minutes so I had to get up and go to the bar and ask for water. Tourette's server finally came to see us but he was seriously a hot mess. 

Ok, let's be honest, I don't know if homeboy actually had tourette's or if he was just having a bad night but every time he walked by our t

wow, only 2.5 stars? I guess it all depends on the individual experiences + what are you looking for.

4 stars for the amazing and scrumptious large-portioned tostada salad. The Cobb salad was pretty good too, very light, huge portions. The bf ordered a fajita however and it was so-so, very meh.

Service was friendly I thought. The waiter even asked if I was 21 then gave me tickets for free drinks.

And it wasn't that loud, during the day/lunch hours at least.
For a quick lunch, why not.
Okay for Mexican. Booked because of how close it was to J lo! Fajitas were average but the real star was Sammy's Tequila Shrimp! Sammy Hagar seems like Guy Fieri with a guitar.

I came here for appetizers and drinks before seeing Britney at PH with some friends. We were short on time so opted to sit at the bar since there was a 30 minute wait to be seated on the patio. The nachos were SO GOOD!!!! Since we just did apps I can't comment on the entrees but the frozen margarita pitcher was tasty as well. Good vibes and friendly service. I will definitely be back for those nachos the next time I'm in Vegas!

Overall a decent place to grab a drink and quick bite. Fajitas were good, beers cold. Only ate there due to lines everywhere else. Not exactly the Cabo like Mexico, more of a chain feel. Service was good. No live music anymore.....minus a star...
....

The location is the perfect place to take a break from walking the strip. The atmosphere is fun! The food was very good and the service was amazing. After our meal we had a few drink and just sat and people watched.

First of all this place is WAY too loud. Don't get me wrong, there is a time & a place to crank it up...like my car...but when you give up completely on trying to talk to the person NEXT TO you (NOT ACROSS) because the screaming you've been trying isn't working...it's time to go down a decibel or 2.

Second, the tables and chairs are made of wood. And, 13 hours later, my a$$ still hurts! No joke. I have never been more uncomfortable at a restaurant ever.

Third, the service. I was in a large party and there was one girl taking care of us w/o help and she did a fantastic job. No one's order got messed up, drinks kept coming (she kept track of what everyone was drinking). She rocked it.

And, lastly, the food. As is pretty typical of the Strip, the food was just OK and WAY overpriced. Portions were slightly on the small side. I had a chicken soft taco which was mediocre at best for $7. It was pretty flavor less. Husband got carnitas something which had rice, beans, and big chunks of pork. He gave it a B. He had soda and I had water. The bill came to almost $30.

Honestly, the only reason I saw the inside of this place was because of the group function I attended. I most likely won't eat here again.

There are literally 50 different Mexican places in LV I would have been happier to eat at for 1/2 the price. Chipotle has is all over this place!! Sammy shouldn't have quit his day job!!
Nice casual place to have good margaritas. Food is good too. House margaritas not so good however cw margaritas are great!

I am writing this for the Cabo Wabo in the Las Vegas Airport. Wow, with hours to kill at America's most skanky airport, what else is there to do but drink? My lady and I decided to get a marg at the Red Rocker's lair on an extended layover between flights. I ordered the signature drink, the "Cabo Wabo," while my wife ordered the "I Can't Drive 55." As somewhat of a mixologist myself I must say that the drinks were subpar but what do you expect from a crummy chain restaurant at the airport? But upon receipt of the bill  we immediately renamed it "Cabo Robbo." 35 bucks for two lousy, no-tequila, corn syruppy "margaritas?" Unfortunately for us, the menu did not have prices but we figured 10 bucks max, not 15. If there had been even an ounce of tequila in the drinks I would not be hating on this business so much. Cabo Wabo deserves to die.

Here's a poem I wrote about it:
Cabo Robbo 
(Sung to the tune of Van Halen's Cabo Wabo)
I've been to Taos; Austin, Texas
Man, I thought I'd seen it all
Around the world, workin' my passport
Man, I thought I'd hit the wall

There's a crappy bar, at Las Vegas Airport
It's called Cabo Robbo cantina and bar
Made me want to file a health report
You know I wanna punch Sammy Hagar

If you go there once, it' won't suffice
Lots of crappy drinks, tasting like bleach
The blue syrup sure makes them look nice
But once you taste one, you wanna screech

We gotta try a shitty bar, called the Cabo Robbo
It ain't alright by me
Come on, let me take you down
The biggest rip off you ever seen
Like a slot machine but more rundown

McCarran Airport, you'd have to see it man
Ain't no picture ever say it right
Walkin' the concourse dodging Nascar fans
Place is filled with scroungy 'Merkans, what a sight?!?
I wanna catch my flight.

You know I wanna get back to Frisco
It ain't all right there
Wish the fog would lift at SFO
Everyone here looks like they eat Crisco

Come on, let me take you down
I will show you around
Let me take you down
The biggest rip off you ever seen
Over the barrel at the Vegas airport

I ate here with my husband and 2 sisters in law earlier this month. We got the table right in the corner by the street, which was great for people watching. We all really liked our food and our waitress was fantastic. The only downfall was not enough shading, causing us to maneuver the table and chairs so we were all mostly covered from the blistering sun. It was pretty expensive as well, but that is Vegas for you.

First of all, my friends and I are locals. We knew about this place and we were hoping they might have some Cinco de Mayo specials or at least some good Mexican festive music. Nope, the joint was blasting their tinny-sounding MP3 music on impressive looking speakers. (waste of good speakers)

So we went out of our way to get here and park so might as well stay a while. I had a feeling our bill was going to be outrageous in the end, but it *IS* the strip so what do you expect. Sort of wish we went to Casa Don Juan but I was overruled. The service we received was actually pretty decent, especially considering how busy it was on a Sunday late afternoon on Cinco de Drinko. Our server was Ashley and she was really sweet, very on top of things so I have no complaints about service. 

We had a party of 5, and we only had to wait maybe 10 or 15 minutes to get seated inside. I ordered a margarita verde which had some cucumbers in it and it was pretty decent, even if it was an overpriced $12, again, it's the Strip. My bf had a couple of regular margaritas, and my friend ordered the "special" margarita which was $20 and you kept the glass. It was a frozen drink and was a pretty big size. She said it was good but on the sweet side. 

My boyfriend and i shared some nacho platter (no meat) and we thought they were really delicious, I was quite surprised especially after seeing such bad reviews on the food. The nacho sauce was really good... and it had plenty of super *hot* jalapenos. We ate it all, it was an enormous portion but I was satisfied with paying $15 for it. My friend ordered an avocado burger which she liked. I think our other friends got shrimp ceviche and beef taquitos. No one complained, and we had been there for at least 2 1/2 or 3 hours. 

I had two margaritas and the bf had 3 margaritas, plus the nachos, and our total came to a whopping $82!!!!! HOLY. COW. The kicker though....  they sneak in this "CNF" charge which was I think 3.5% of the bill. It was around $2.70 on ours anyway. We questioned the fee and the waitress said she "didn't know what CNF stood for, but it was something the casino or the mall made them pay because they had to pay for rental space there??!!!" WHAAAAAA...? It wasn't a very good explanation. Since when does something like that get absorbed by the customers, isn't that the cost of doing business on the miracle mile? Just another Strip ripoff. We didn't make a big deal out of it with her but we weren't very happy with the extra charge. Probably not coming back here anytime soon. The reason for the stars rating is because of the prices and the ripoff CNF charge, come on, management, really!?
Below average Mexican at exhorbitant prices. The beer came in a plastic cup. The only thing worthwhile was sitting outside overlooking the strip.

Oh Cabo Wabo! I honestly can't say anything bad about this restaurant.  I came here Sunday night as this was one of the bars for my Las Vegas Club Crawl. The drinks were very good and strong just like I like it! 

I seen people eating but didnt pay to much attention to it since my main mission was to drink and have a good time.

The next day I woke up and all I could think about was Cabo Wabo! I was trying to find good Groupon deals and spotted Cabo Wabo had a $15 for $30 worth of food. I was like two tears in a bucket, f*** it! We're going to Cabo Wabo!

It's walking distance from the Caesars Palace. Once I got there we were seated immediately outside near the heaters as it was very cold outside. I liked sitting outside on the patio because your able to see the water show from where your seating and eating. 

The nice attractive server Stephanie asked us if we wanted to start off with a beverage and i instantly said margarita please! ;). Dont forget to check in to get your free margarita! 

Everything on the menu looked good especially after looking at the pictures on Yelp. I ordered the appetizer of chips and salsa which was not expensive at all $3.95 you can not beat that especially for the amount that you get!

For my entree, I decided on the shrimp tacos and double rice since I'm not into the beans. I was very hesitant in ordering the chicken enchiladas because it looked very good as well but after talking to the server Stephanie she let me know that the shrimp tacos was a better choice. 

Babe ordered a burrito which came with nacho chips on the side which were very good! The cheese that they use for their nachos were a plus!

I also liked that the drinks were very strong and tasty! They know exactly what to do to get you to buy more than one lol.

 I would definitely recommend this if you're in the area of the miracle mile shop and looking for something to eat. They had many different things on their menu with a lot of good varieties you will not be disappointed!

This spot is centrally located on the strip right in front of Planet Hollywood.  What an awesome spot to people watch and just take in Vegas!  The outdoor seating always keeps cool thanks to the many misters strategically scattered about the deck.  Great spot for tequlia--obviously, and the bartenders are always friendly.  Food was pretty decent here.  I will definitely be back.

Ate dinner here before a show and was highly disappointed! As everything is in Vegas the food was overpriced and the quality was extremely bad. Tortillas that were brought out for fajitas were at least a week old and were very elastic. TERRIBLE!

We went to breakfast here with excitement for the bottomless mimosas. However, the "bottomless" mimosas were only refilled once and that was after having to ask our waitress for another. 

We were surprised to see low prices compared to virtually every other restaurant in Vegas. But, when the food came- it became clear why. The food was marginal at best.

The place was dead at 11pm last night so we assumed this is a daytime place?

The waitress was attentive but we had to track her down at the end to get our bill.

The nachos with chicken were good with a delicious Queso sauce. (about $14)

We also got the Taquitos which were okay. 

The weekly special was a $7.50 Fireball shot but I got the Key Lime Pie martini was too milky, strong, and sweet.

Overall, this is a good place to get a quick bite and drink if there is no wait.

Meh. I got the Mexican Chopped Salad and added grilled shrimp for $6...I received FOUR SHRIMP! The salad tasted not very fresh. The best thing about this place is the location and the outdoor seating right on the strip. That's about it.

I'm shocked that the food at this corporate-merchandising tourist trap was quite good.  Ya gotta love Sammy Hagar, but I despise chains, for the most part.  

I noticed that recent reviews are stellar, yet overall the ranking is mediocre for this establishment.  Based on my experience, they definitely must have cleaned house and changed up the menu/management.  My cilantro jalapeño chicken entree was delicious.  

Sit outside if it isn't too hot.  It's across from the Bellagio fountains and a massive people-watching opportunity.

We were very surprised by this place. Looks like just a bar when you walk by. We stopped in for breakfast on Saturday morning 9/23/17. Waffles were very good, egg plate with bacon was also very good and omelettes were on point.

We had 2 different margaritas and salad here. Both were good but the margaritas seemed kind of watered down. I really enjoyed the carne asada southwest Cobb salad, it was light and I didn't leave feeling over full like you can in a lot of Vegas restaurants.

We came here because we were starving, and looking for mexican food. Well, we really messed up picking this place.

There's a patio area and then the area inside. We decided to eat inside, even though the girl told us there was karaoke going on inside. Big mistake. We stepped into deafening noise. The "DJ" there thought he was the funniest, cutest thing, but he was actually just obnoxious. The only people there doing karaoke were his friends and family. Like, his mom and shit. What was funny is he had a laptop to DJ. And he was shit at it. He would blast a song during every interval, and then act all flustered cause he had "so many people to get through" that night. There were two people besides us that weren't his family. Too loud and too annoying.

Also, the cooks didn't take the wrapper off of my fiance's cheese and put it on his burger. WTF. And the waiter was a jerk. I finished my water and ate my ice, and he brought out 3 more waters, I guess to be funny? I finished it because you didn't bring my drink within 10 minutes. Then he randomly stopped by and left his own personal drink on our table. wtf wtf wtf. Never again.
Good job!  Four of us had dinner.  The four different dinners were elegantly prepared and served soon after we ordered.  Will go back.  Check out the Margarita offer if you are a member of Yelp.

What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas  ...unless it's delicious happy hours chicken taquito and mixed (watered down) shots!  The flavor was reminiscent of delicious but the chicken was a bit scorched on either ends.

The food is not good enough for the price, but that's what you get when you're on the strip.
A little inappropriate that the hostesses call one of the managers "Big Daddy" but I guess that's not my business.I'll never go back.

Came in tonight for my friend's 21st birthday. We drove 4+ hours today to enjoy his celebration and this was one of the first stops we made and we were NOT impressed. The hostess was very friendly and helped us out with finding a seat outside. Once we were sat, our server took a look over our ID's. We are all from Arizona and have the SAME driver licenses. Our server took one the ID's and had told us that she couldn't serve our friend because her I.D wasn't an exact replica. It was a real license. I asked to speak with the manager(crystal) TWICE... and she definitely took her time to come approach us. Once she did, she responded that she couldn't do anything about it.  I told her I would be a cop into  It and she simply replied "Do whatever. These are my policies" we closed out our tab immediately. Extremely upset with the way this place handles things. Never coming back again.   
Do not recommend this place
Last night in Vegas was awesome. My cousin and I had a great time eating here the food was good but the service was amazing! Danny was awesome! Thank you for the wonderful service and great ambience.
Found our go to restaurant in Vegas when visiting the mall or going to the hypnosis show. I loved the steak quesadillas...you won't be disappointed!

Stay away! This restaurant is the epitome of the shitty overpriced food that the Strip is well-known for. I dined here based on the recommendation of a friend who said that the atmosphere of the restaurant was lively and entertaining. However, they had never actually dined there themselves. I did them a solid and told them to avoid this place at all costs.

My main motivation for choosing this spot was that it is directly across the street from my hotel (Cosmopolitan). While the service and atmosphere were fairly pleasant, the food was a downright letdown. My sister and I ordered two cappuccinos, carne asada tacos, and guacamole. Everything was at most mediocre in taste with the exception of the carne asada tacos. Those came with a side of rice and beans which were absolutely disgusting to the point where I couldn't get myself to finish them. The beans were stale and lacking in flavor. They literally tasted as if they had been left out sitting for an hour or so. Gross! The rice tasted as if it had come directly from a box and soaked in tomato sauce.
