The big negative was that our waitress didn't come pick up our check . We waited for about 30mins and ended up giving it to another waitress.

All in all atmosphere was great, food was decent, service wasn't too good, but they do give you a little postcard with your picture on it that you can use for 20%off your next visit which is a nice souvenir.

Great little place to rest after a hot walk in Vegas! They have a patio with misters to beat the heat. Also their food was very delicious. I had one of the specials, it was good, can't pronounce it or even attempt to spell it, but it was good. The Jalapeño Picante margarita was amazing! Mangos, jalapeños, tequila, and spicy salt. Mmmmm.  Service was very good. Waiter was friendly and very helpful. I will be back for sure!

In Vegas for few days........one of our first stops on the strip was Cabo Wabo Cantina. Needless to say, it was not our last visit!!!  The food was great but the service was even better.  Ask for Laura if she is available.........what a sweet girl and great server. 
As far as bartenders........OMG,, Kristy will have you splitting your sides laughing and she makes the most AWESOME MARGARITA!!!!!!!!!!!!   All around good experience.

Had the hand stirred pina colada with agave rim & roasted coconut flakes! It was definitely a cocktail to remember. Shared the red enchiladas plate with rice and beans, since we weren't too hungry. It was the perfect combination for a relaxing brunch on a beautiful day! The view and weather was great... we will be back! Especially since we are sister states. See you soon Cabo Wabo!

Our final Saturday evening meal in Las Vegas was supposed to be at Burgr, but the line wrapped around the casino. So we decided to go to Cabo Wabo. We were seated inside right away. Not very busy around 5pm. The waitress was nice and attentive. Our food and drinks came quickly.

I ordered the chicken quesadilla, which was quite possibly the best I've ever had. The tortilla was extremely thin and crisp. It came with the perfect portion of rice and beans. The side of guacamole and sauce went really well with it. I'd definitely come back. For 4 entrees and 2 drinks we paid about $25 each after we split the bill with tip. I think the prices are what's expected of Vegas, but of course over priced for the food you get especially the drinks. I paid $12 for a tall beer on tap.

Note:  we were under the influence during this meal!

Chicken fajitas were well flavored and juicy.  The portion size was pretty large.  Gotta love homemade tortillas (at least they looked homemade).  We also ordered queso.  It had a unique taste that at first I wasn't sure of, but it grew on me over time.  The salsa was a highlight of the meal with a smoky flavor.

Sat at the bar for drinks. Rock Daddy was playing, not too bad of a band (80s and 90s rock). Went outside to sit and people watch for a little bit since there are tables right on the Strip. Too cold, so went back inside. Surrounding people were all very nice. The bartenders were all really cool, too. Generous pours , huge shots, and not ridiculous prices for drinks. 

Some people were still ordering food even though it was late. I did not try the food but the smell of all of the fajitas when they were brought by started to make me nauseous. 

Supposedly all of the bands have to play Sammy songs as part of their sets. It's a requirement to play there. The only song I heard when I was there was "Can't Drive 55".

Checked this place out for happy hour. 
Margaritas were good, sangria was so-so, nachos were delicious, wings were fantastic, service was great and location and patio were wonderful. 
I will def go back for happy hour during my next visit to Vegas.
Great food and drink !!! Great place eat having a few margaritas sit on patio and people watch.

My margarita was perfect. Chips were good and salsa was amazing. The music drew us in. We really wanted to eat but way too expensive, but I guess we were on the strip with an amazing view, so it's expected. Our waiter Anthony was awesome and very attentive.

Great little place to come have a drink 
And little quick stop if you're walking  the strip and you want a quick sit down drink and snacks 
They have a greasy little snack menu 
Great chips and salsa and guacamole
Prices are ok 
Drinks can use a little help 
Service was great tonight that we came the man that served us loves what he does and he was amazing 
Restrooms are all the way back there if you are sitting outside 
Inside have a cute little country touch

Wonderful!!! Average price for Vegas. But incredible drinks, even better food and even BETTER service! Joe was our server and he's so friendly, attentive and not pushy. Chicken tacos and the best and chicken enchiladas are wonderful. I will absolutely return.

This is always our go-to spot when we visit Las Vegas because the service is always amazing, super fast, it's not over priced like the other restaurants on the strip, and the food is amazing! 
The last time we went, we had the shrimp tacos, fish tacos, nacho platter, and a pitcher of the CW Margarita. In the past we've had the enchiladas, chicken plate, and all of the above has always been amazing! There is even a patio area located right along the strip so you can enjoy awesome views of the Bellagio Fountain!
I've always wished there was a Cabo Wabo exactly the same as this here in LA but unfortunately there isn't. Can't wait to be back again!

Excellent breakfast!!! If you're staying on the strip and don't want a super expensive breakfast at one of the hotels, definitely check out cabo wabo. I highly recommend the CW eggs Benedict and the breakfast quesadilla. Delicious!!!

*Pitchers aren't happy hour*

Went for Happy Hour for drinks. The waitress said that margaritas are half off so we ordered a pitcher. When we got the bill the waitress then told us that only individual glasses of margaritas are Happy Hour, not pitchers.

Very bad, rude and bitchy service. My cousin and I baught drinks while on our way out and our server at the bar was just so rude! She's fortunate I don't remember her name but I think she was one of the supervisors (because she was telling people what to do and ppl came to her for things) and she was not pleasant. The way she talked to us was just bitchy! I do t know how else to explain it.

Las Vegas is one of the most popular vacation cities and you need to work on your customer service because you never know who's gonna write about you on Yelp!

My husband and I had lunch at Cabo Wabo when we got tired of wandering around The Strip. The outdoor seating in the sunshine was definitely a huge draw. Still a bit chilly in the shade, but they had heat lamps. Bonus: there was a decent view of the Bellagio fountains. 

It may be a Mexican food chain, but I thought the food was fine. The service was great too. Friendly and attentive. Even though there were vegetarian options on the menu, we stuck to appetizers. The salsa had a smoky flavor, and the guacamole was good. We also shared a cheese crisp, which was similar to a cheese quesadilla. Overall, not the cheapest spot for food and drinks, but it is Vegas after all.

Ask for ITSEL SHE IS SO AWESOME!!!! 

VERY cute and very sweeet. 

She was super helpful and happy. She deserves her job!

Sure.. Tourist trap! But excellent service, good coffee, and the Eggs Benedict was soooo good! It was so windy and cold when we were here so we couldn't sit outside on the cool deck overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Oh well

Decor looks like Margaritaville a block away, but I think the food was better here!

My wife and I ate lunch on 5/5/2015.  We had the Short Rib Enchiladas and the Chicken Tostada Salad.  Both were very good, and the service was great also.  We were surprised how good the food was for a novelty chain restaurant.

Due to the plethora of reviews, I will summarize my comments via bullet point:
-Great and personable bar tenders
-Classic and spicy Bloody Mary (lovely cure for rough mornings)
-Go with the any of their chicken breast meals
-Great people watching during the day
-Gets a bit douchey at night.

Collectively, not a bad place to spend an afternoon.

Very delicious food and good service. Will come back. 
We had baja fish taco and carne asada tacos. Both really good. Will be back!

Pretty good food, pretty good drinks, expensive but that is typical for Vegas.  The best part about this place is when they play Mas Tequila you run to the bar where the wait staff is waiting standing on top of the bar to pour tequila right into your mouth.  Pretty good tequila too.  Go on Sunday night when the have karaoke to a live band.  VERY FUN!  We went the end of August this year and it was not very crowded.  I will for sure be back the next time I am in Vegas which I hope is soon!

Great location right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip. Service was super friendly and the food was yummy. Large portion sizes and reasonable prices considering the prime location.
I'd definitely eat here again.
Way overpriced, even for Vegas. The food is an embarrassment. "Nachos" are six chips on a plate with a sprinkle of cheese. I would expect much better from the Red Rocker. You're dead to me Sammy.

Atmosphere was nice. 

Service was good. Server told us about the drinks happy hour. 

Food was decent. I would come back to eat here.
$14 for a draft beer? Only reason I stopped was because we had walked all day. I know the strip can be pricey but come on!!
The food was good but the service was slow. The tamarind margarita was awesome! The chicken with cheese was very flavorful.
This spot was awesome, great location outside on the strip. Music playing, and our server Nathan was knowledgeable and cool.

We have loved visiting Cabo Wabo on recent Vegas trips. We like to belly up to the bar to people watch and take in the Bellagio fountains from a distance. I had shrimp tacos on this visit, subbing chips and salsa for rice and beans. I would have preferred grilled shrimp over fried, but I still enjoyed the tacos. My husband had the lobster burrito. He gives it a 7/10. We both left satisfied. The price is what it is...you're on the strip. Service was great on the patio. We will continue to return. 
Also, live music on a Tuesday night at 8:30 just as we were finishing. He was entertaining.

No surprise. Very basic grub served by tough looking staff. Overpriced. You get what you would expect from something owned by Sammy Hagar. Only went to take advantage of deal for frozen margaritas - meh. Skip it unless you are DESPERATE.

I started here on a club crawl. They were very nice to us. They put out appetizers and chips and dips. Drinks were fine but a bit pricy. Should have been able to pick our own shot. The one they gave us was awful.

Empty dining room at 7:30 pm?  Should've know it would suck.  If I'm paying $20 bucks for below-mediocre tex mex could I have a glass instead of a frat party plastic cup?  I'm trying to think of something that I liked about this place besides my company and I can only come up with "well, at least I didn't get food poisoning".

This place is fun and a party time.  We sat at the outside bar and the staff was great.  Drinks were fantastic and really enjoyed the Taquitos.  Great place to party.  Cinco de Mayo party was great, especially the music.

After seeing "Vegas the Show" we were famished and needed a bite to eat before hitting a club.  We stopped at Cabo Wabo Cantina for an appetizer sampler.  To call the food mediocre would be generous.  The chips came from a bag.  There was fat in the meat on the nachos and everything was greasy.  It was loud as a club in the empty restaurant for no reason at all.

On the plus side: our waitress was friendly.

Also, there is a "franchise fee" tacked onto each bill.  They do not tell you this ahead of time.  I have never seen this done anywhere else.  It is a percentage of your bill, so BEWARE!

The epic debate of how many stars to give! Almost gave 3, but...
First off, on the food, I've had only had the guacamole and I loved it. I'm an admitted avocado whore so it's hard to not make me love guac. 
Usually when I come to Cabo Wabo it's to have drinks outside and people watch (perfect spot for it).
I would give this place 5 stars if I could always sit at the bar top outside... primarily because that's how I know my drinks are amazing! And I do mean amazing. Whenever I've ordered a drink from a server, it tends to come to me...not what I had ordered (hence 3 stars). I'll admit when it comes to margaritas I'm relatively particular, but I'm pretty clear about what I'm looking for. 
Either way, it's still my favorite "cantina" on the strip, and will always fight for a seat at the bar top. Wait, I'm off tomorrow! I'm so overdue.

First night in Vegas. Saw the fountains then headed over for a drink. Just for checking in on yelp I got a free voucher for a margarita with the purchase of an entree. I don't like margaritas but as a teacher getting something for free brings a smile to my face. 

We sat at the inside bar
Waiting for a seat on the rail outside so we could watch everything. There was a band upstairs also. This place is owned by Sammy Hagar and his beer Red Head is on draft. If your in Vegas it's worth a stop.

I came here for the new Santo Mezquila and my Waborita fix (and to satisfy my need to add another Sammy shirt to my collection).  A forever fan of the Cabo.... Happy hour shots are $5.  Yes sir may I have another!

Food was good, service was awesome but we had a HORRIBLE experience with a manager named Ryan. He made us feel like we were in the wrong and very uncomfortable when we wanted to change an order. We will not be returning because of him.

The food is standard Tex Mex fare, but the shining aspect of Cabo Wabo is their staff. The wait for a table was close to half an hour, on a weekday, so we sat at the bar. One of the barbacks, Chris(?), was phenomenal. He took care of us from start to finish. 

The signature margarita was good, but the coconut one was the best. It is similar to a daiquiri. 

The food teetered on okay to good. The bacon wrapped shrimp was delicious, but it is hard not to love goat cheese stuffed shrimp wrapped in bacon and then fried. The rice needs a little work. Not much flavor there. The tuna ceviche is closer to a tartar. It borderlines on the sweet side. The spicy shrimp with garlic chips was one of the better dishes. It had a balance of flavors and not just overtly spice levels.

Jason, the GM, came by to talk to us and was very friendly. It is refreshing to see management touch the tables and actually care about the guest's experience. Adam, another manager came around to introduce himself as well. It was a fun service experience. I would like to come back when I have more free time to check out their tequila selection.

Good food at reasonable prices, especially for Las Vegas. A bonus the have Coke products in an area where it is all Pepsi!  Pete was our server and he was friendly and made sure we were taken care  of.  Food proportions were plentiful, but not so much that you are wasting tons of food. It looks like it is hopping later in the day, but it is quiet in the morning. I definitely recommend it for breakfast.

It does not get better than this on a Spring day, with chairs on the patio and chips and queso! I wasn't really a fan of their sangria, it was the weakest I've ever had. If you want to sit and relax and have a view of the strip this is the best spot! But as far as drinks go, at least the sangria....pass! the waitresses are very nice. had a spill and they were very fast to come with water and napkins for our little mess. Vibe is so chill and lovely spot to see the whole strip action.
Great food, fast service and awesome margaritas on the patio made for a great lunch!

Really not much here to say. The location overlooking the strip is amazing. City center and Bellaggio's fountains are across the street. The food and drinks are mediocre. But the food is overpriced and the drinks are wayyyyy overpriced. Seriously, $11 for a margarita served in a plastic cup and a $9 beer. Stay clear. Go to the lounge in Cosmopolitan for similar prices. 

Exc - View
Good - None
Ave -Food
Poor -WAYYY overpriced

WOULD I GO BACK? No.

Came here on a Thursday night during a rush and were seated on the patio (our preference) within 10 minutes. We had the pleasure of having Danny as our sever-he was fabulous!! Attentive, fun, and charming. Do yourself a favor-come here and enjoy a delicious margarita and live music!

John bartender at this joint is by far welcoming and responsive.  Although it was a short visit dude took care of me and I am very appreciative....Dennis Rodman was here during the night however it was calmly handled...it was my birthday and John took care of me....appreciate the restaurant vibe as well as John.

My first trip to Vegas and we went to Cabo every night. The drinks were amazing. Being able to get pitchers of mixed drinks was awesome. Yes it's pricey but so is everywhere you go in Vegas. 
Our waitress is what really gave it the 5th star. Her name was Laura and she was great. Very friendly everytime we came in. 
If you are in Vegas you need to go to Sammy Hagars Cabo Wabo!

Worst experience in Vegas.  No one knew how to light the heat lamps.   No rice and beans with fajitas until we asked and then were told they were extra. Fine, so offer it when we order, dude! And then the waiter stood and waited for us to pay when he dropped the check. Really? You're gonna hover over me after you drop the check? Ghetto!
Order a steak burrito and got a rice burrito. They bearly put any meat on my burrito. I decided just to throw it away and write this review.

I've been to Cabo Wabo a couple of times and while it's pricey for what you get, it's Vegas and that's how every place is.  At least at Cabo Wabo, you can sit outside and people watch while you eat and drink.  The tacos are fairly good and the drinks don't have to be sweet if you ask for them to be that way.  Service was pretty good and I'll definitely be back.

Was wanting one of those humongous margarita's everyone was walking around town with.  I got a pina colada flavor and the whole thing was a giant slushy. No alcohol taste whatsoever. I guess I paid the price for falling into the the tourist trap type drinks. Not doing that again.

This was a fun environment. The food tasted good, just a little pricey. My husband had a quesadilla that was coated in a Parmesan cheese that was great! I had the appetizer chicken taquitos that made for a nice small meal. You did have to pay for chips and salsa which I'm not used to. Our waitress was friendly as well.

Bad, bad,bad and BAD! Right from the beginning with had issues with this place, as soon as we walked in, the host wanted us to sit in the middle of the restaurant, right in front of the sun, we explained her that we don't want to be in the sun so she suggested another table, IN THE SUN. We pointed out that there are at least 15 other tables that are not in the sun, so she finally allowed us to sit there, while mumbling something about "how she just sat someone else in this area" (Not sure what she meant by that, but didn't really care). 

After that, It took forever to order, then, I asked for Ketchup and they totally ignored me, after 10 mins I asked from someone else for ketchup, then I finally got it.  The food was OK but nothing special. 

Skip that one.

GREAT FOOD
Great view
TERRIBLE service

We sat first, couple to the right got served their drinks before us, we ordered an appetizer, guy to the left sat after us and got his appetizer before us.  Our waitress THEN came back w/out drinks to ID us after about 10 mins of waiting. I was not a happy camper. Appetizer never showed, dinner came, and unfortunately it was really good. BUT I'd never go back.  Go to Border Grille or the Mexican place in the shopping center across from the Wynn. 

But don't go here.

Cabo Wabo for breakfast. The breakfast special is a great deal and well worth it. The Mexican Omlette is delicious. The Breakfast Burrito is great. The Bloody Mary was ok not the best not the worst.  The Mimosa was good. The frozen margarita was good. The service was exceptional.
Cool place, the server was great!  Had a Denver omelet which was very good, great margaritas, and a flight of Cabo Wabo tequila.   Will definitely be going back here on the next Vegas trip!

Not a very pleasant experience as I had set a very high expectations for this place. We were a party of 8, got a table and until that point everything was OK, the wait wasn't too bad. Off coarse, we get a waiter that all hyped up and was rushing us to order, I ask for some Salsa and Chips, he acted all surprised and said that he will charge me for it, OK, no problem. Then we go on and I asked for a green salsa and his reply was "you can have whatever you want" not to mention he was going to tag me with additional $9.00 for Guacamole dip, well I asked for green Salsa not a dip. We go on without any complaints as we all felt the situation was weird. The food comes in, I ordered the fish of the day, Scottish Salmon, good plate presentation until the plate tasted like all SALT, went on and tried to eat as we were all starving, it got to the point where I could not continue. Mentioned it to the MOD and she did a great job by addressing it. Bottom line, it wasn't a well perceived experience.

Okay, so the margaritas aren't great. The food isn't either. The music is mostly annoying, BUT the chips are really delicious. They're like the perfect thickness, warm, and salty. Just perfect. It's a good (unhealthy) snack when you're stuck near Planet Hollywood and need to burn some time.
Great drinks. Incredibly rude service. Very unfortunate
Food was delicious, drinks were on point and the service was fantastic. Thanks Bernard!!!
good spot for people watching -but the service is rude and beer was warm and slow to arrive.

The Cabo Wabo Cantina is one of my favorite places to visit every time I go to Las Vegas! 

They have an awesome deck that is right on the strip just outside of Planet Hollywood.  One of the best people watching areas in the country!  Combine that with awesome service, solid food and great drinks and you've got yourself a great time!

Our most recent visit was on 10/20/14.  We were pleasantly greeted and opted for a table right on the rail so we could enjoy the sights.  I will say that they now pump in music...and my previous choice of the bar style seating is now less desirable because the music would be a bit loud there (wait, did I just say that?  music is NEVER too loud..but you get what I mean).

Our server, Ashley, was very nice, kept our drinks filled and provided great service....consistent with every single time we've visited Cabo Wabo! 4 or 5 times there and we've always been very well taken care of.

I tried a few different drinks...a cucumber based margarita...a 'sangarita' (their twist on a sangria, it's pinot noir and tequila) which was better than I anticipated but probably wouldn't get it again, and the standard ol' Waborita, which is my ultimate favorite.

The food is consistently good.  You DO have to pay for chips and salsa (only a couple bucks though) and the salsa is worth it..very tasty.  I used to get the tequila shrimp, but they've removed it from the menu so this time I had the fish tacos (with chipotle crema), while my date had the carne asada tacos (which looked and were delicious..and included avacado!).  It's not 5 star food, but it's way better than normal bar food.

Ultimately it's the combination of location, atmosphere, service, drinks and food that makes Cabo Wabo a winner.  Grab a seat on the rail, a Waborita and enjoy the sights and sounds of the Vegas strip!
Betsy was the best server. Week night. The food, server. All amazing. Couldn't, wouldn't complain. Amazing over all.

Loved this place. Sat outside and people-watched on Las Vegas Blvd. Fish tacos were delicious and served with a side of refried beans and rice. The Cabo frozen margarita was AWESOME, both the original and mango version. Wonderfully refreshing on a 97-degree afternoon. Server was very good. Only reason I didn't award them 5 stars is that I found the menu items a bit pricey, even for Vegas. Even so, I would go back, if only for their margaritas!

After missing out on trying the Bacchanal buffet with my friends (I got in a few hours later than they did), I was determined to try something new so that I would still have something else to write about.  Fortunately/unfortunately, that "something new" ended up being Cabo Wabo...which always seemed like more of a drinking spot than as a place to eat at.  Now I know why!

Although Cabo Wabo isn't a mainstream type of chain restaurant, it's still pretty much a chain, and the food really reflected that.  I kept expectations to a minimum for my CARNITAS TACOS, and what I got was pretty mediocre...and overpriced.  Two tacos, Spanish rice, and beans for $15?  I know it's The Strip and all, but damn (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cabo-wabo-cantina-las-vegas?select=vguZqf4mTUutzMe9wgw8Sw#J9PUAWgzOp0UnrzmnXG4bg).  The taste of the carnitas was driven heavily by their generic sauce rather than the savory, seasoned flavors you'd get from something authentic, but at least the tacos were fairly full...so yay?

As far as our drinks went, my friends seemed mostly satisfied with what they had.  I ordered the CHUPA CHUPA cocktail, which was kind of fun to drink but not particularly amazing.  Essentially, they flip a mini Corona into a regular margarita at your table, and you have to quickly drink it before it all overflows (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cabo-wabo-cantina-las-vegas?select=vguZqf4mTUutzMe9wgw8Sw#RV-cRSWcsgg5ITs4n6OcAQ).  Creative and unique, but pricey considering it wasn't that heavy on the alcohol.
 
Amazingly though, what hurt more than overpaying for generic and medicore food was my lack of reception stopping me from checking in on Yelp when we first sat down.  As petty and trivial as that sounds, I would have seen the "Free margarita with the purchase of an entrée" deal before I ordered, and I could have saved myself $12 on that Chupa Chupa!  Ugh...

I go to Cabo Wabo every time I come to Vegas. The margaritas are strong and some of the best I've had. I always order the Cocorita but am often tempted by other enticing drinks on their large menu. 

They do not serve free chips and salsa, which is unfortunate for a Mexican restaurant but I go there for the nachos so I don't mind. The nacho platter with carne asada is my go-to and perfect as a meal for two people, alongside some ice cold margaritas. 

I always come to Vegas during the most crowded times of the year and have never had to wait to sit inside. There is usually a wait for outside seating, which overlooks the strip.

Although the margaritas were tasty, they were pretty expensive!! And honestly I had a hard time finishing my grilled fish tacos, they just weren't  that great, my dad had the lobster enchilada and that was ok, I also tasted the Cadillac nachos, all in all nothing special. Good location mediocre food over priced drinks. Nothing surprising here

Love love love  love, LOVE Cabo Wabo. Make a special trip every year to the Tahoe location for my birthday. I've been to the Vegas location once before and wasn't overly excited. But this last trip, once again, made me fall in love all over again! I eat nachos ONCE A YEAR and Cabo Wabo is my only choice. The server suggested shrimp on my nachos. Freaking amazing. Great margaritas too. Good Service. Really nice patio with great people watching. Can't wait to go back. Counting down. Oh, and strangely enough, my boyfriend tried their burger (I know right, burger--at a Mexican restaurant?) and said it was to die for!

I was in las vegas staying at the Paris hotel for my sisters bachelorette weekend and we decided to come here for breakfast before walking the whole strip. I thought it was way too early to drink so I didnt get to taste the drinks but the girls said they were strong and good. I don't recall the name of what I had for breakfast but do remember finishing the whole plate and it was just what i needed. In fact, all the girls devoured most of their food. We were at the outdoors seating and it was nice for people watching, and to plan our next adventure. I would return here on MY future bachelorette weekend !!

We had a bit of a service problem at lunch time. We couldn't get refills in a timely manner and it took some time to get through the meal. It's better than Yolo's and the other Mexican food I had there but it's not up to that Texas - Cali Mexican food level.

That said - the quesadillas were fantastic. They have a nice crust to the outside that I hadn't seen before. The queso was below average in my mind but the drinks were good and it was a nice place. Again, this whole no free chips and salsa thing kind of blows my mind when getting Mexican food...
If you come here, ask for Danny.  This guy will definitely make sure you're taken care of.    Tacos were awesome!  Margaritas are some of the better ones I've found on the strip!

We had dinner here before heading out to a show because one of my friends that we were with has a little bro who's obsessed with Sammy Hagar. The place was pretty empty, so we got seated quickly.

For a place that's named after a tequila brand, I was expecting WAY more from my margarita. Super, super sugary and not much tequila taste, and no where near enough salt.

The place gets 2 stars because the nachos were really good. They're "build your own" and over priced, but tasty and a HUGE amount. But they arrived just a couple min before the rest of our food. And the rest of the food was TERRIBLE. My husband said the fish tacos were just ok, and everything on my combo plate was bland and greasy. 

Service was super slow for an empty restaurant, but the girl who came around to take pics was nice, and the hostesses let us snag a menu for my friend's bro.

We ate at Salsa Cantina in Miracle Mile a couple nights before and it was SOOOO much better, even the margaritas, and cheaper. Save yourself the trip to Cabo Wabo unless you're drinking Modelo on the patio to people watch... bottled beer they can handle.

Went here on a Saturday mid-afternoon and were pleased to hear that buckets (6) of beer were only $20 - NOWHERE I found on the strip had buckets for less than $35 so that was a nice price break!

We had THE BEST server... very cool, conversational, fun and handsome.  We really enjoyed our time with him.  

We each ordered a chicken and a beef taco.  The flavor of the tacos was good and it was great to see a place claiming to serve Mexican food ACTUALLY USE MEXICAN CHEESE!   But $13 for two tacos was a little steep, regardless of how good they are.

Overall, my experience seems to be better than some on here...but YES it is a tourist trap.  And if I could offer a suggestion - when in Vegas - try your hardest to avoid female servers/waitresses/bartenders.  They are all so sick of drunk tourist and/or businessmen hitting on them non-stop that they all have a chip on their shoulder.  Avoid them.

What a fantastic afternoon of day-drinking. Sat at the bar and Shane was our server. Such a fun guy- lots of conversation about the area, kept us hydrated with his phenomenal cocktails, and the food was tasty as well. Going back tomorrow for breakfast. Check it out - great drinks, great food, and GREAT TIMES!!!
One of my favorite places!!! It's so much fun! Great place for large groups!!! Definitely a must go when in Las Vegas!

2.5 stars but I'll round up because everything in Vegas is pricey. 

The atmosphere about this place is cool.  So for those tired of going to upscale Vegas restaurants, this is a good place to chill and drink some frozen margaritas and relax.  Especially a good way to get out of the Vegas heat.

Order the Carne Asada tacos and it was nothing special.  Tacos were a little small but it was good.   But its no way it should be 17 dollars.  Anywhere else and this would be a taco plate appetizer.  Grabbed some shots of tequila that were $11 dollars as well.  Overall just a meh experience. 

Again the 3 stars is generous because everything in Vegas is high.  And our waitress was really cool.  But otherwise it would be more towards that 2-2.5 range.

Cabo Wabo averages 2.5 stars so let's face it I didn't choose it for the menu or service. This place does have a few great things going for it- they took our reservation of 14 (tough to find on the strip without a set menu), there is a beautiful patio located in the middle of the strip (with a view of the Bellagio fountains), it's a fun atmosphere with music, and the price point is low. Sold!

So why only 3 stars? We should have been assigned our own server with a group our size, but we weren't. It took forever to get chips/salsa (which they charge for!), I got my drink after my meal though I ordered it long before, and a couple of the orders were wrong. I asked for no onions or sour cream on my tostada and it had both. Also, one of the girl's tostadas was missing the tostada (no tortillas)! Not sure who else's order was screwed up.

The food was actually really good, no complaints there. But my big complaint was when the checks came (we had 7 checks) I left to go deal with our transportation at this point... I got back 20 minutes later and checks were still sitting there with our cash/credit cards. As you can imagine our hummer limo waited for an extra 30 minutes for us and I paid about $40 more because of it. Not happy with the service here at Cabo Wabo.

Um....is there booze in those things!? This review is for the "to-go" frozen drink stand only. Seriously. Go for the 'extra shot' deal. They may be expensive, but they don't taste like they have alcohol in them. They are OK in flavor....definitely mix the Pina Colada with Strawberry.

This place is mediocre and pricey. All of their tacos are soft shelled except for one of them, so I was forced to get that one because they pre make them so they couldn't switch out the shell and I hate soft shell tacos. 

Tacos come with rice and refried beans which I didn't want, so I asked for double rice. I think they forgot that I asked for double rice. I'm kind of glad they did because the rice was dry and unflavorful. I literally had to drown it in salt and pepper. The tacos were good. They were the beef ones without any dairy, added avocado and cilantro. 

We got the bill and we were charged some odd fee. I asked the waiter about it and apparently it's because they are in the Planet Hollywood mall, so they pass it on to the customer. NOT COOL. I won't be going back for expensive, mediocre food and ridiculous fees on top of it.
Best dinner! Ask for Loriana as your server, she is a BOSS! So attentive and fun. Thanks!!

Omg Cabo wabo is the full Mexican experience.  I haven't had tacos this bomb since TJ.  Bartenders  are hello kool.  Mt new bar tender homeroom is getting  down with the mix drinks.  I love this place!!

Our group ordered the appetizer sampler to share. It was okay but I think the only reason I thought that was because I was starving. In retrospect, it probably wasn't that good. The short rib taco I got was okay as well. Portions were very large and they have a good variety of drinks. They do have a nice patio overlooking the strip. Service was good.

Cabo Wabo has some tasty food and is one of my favorite places to eat and drink in Vegas.  We love the outside patio area at night or during the day.  They do have misters' on a warm Vegas day to cool you off on the patio.  The breakfast here is good too.  The fish tacos and shrimp tacos are both great.  The chorizo queso is excellent, and the chips and salsa are also great.  The drink prices are kind of high, but you get an awesome view of the strip.  If you want some tasty food or a good drink go here and try to sit on the patio.

ROACHES! ROACHES!! Went to eat a late dinner ended up throwing up my $22 Nachos after a cockroach crawled across the floor next to my foot! Bus boy stomped on it and just left it there next to my table on the floor. Was totally grossed out!!!! The waitress tried to explain why because of the indoor/outdoor setup but that really didn't help with the dead cockroach on the floor still!! Called the restaurant manager the next day and all he did was apologized,..... totally disappointed in how the whole situation was handled including the manager. Didn't even comp our meal or anything.....bad ending to my birthday weeke

Went for some quick nachos and a margarita- Waited 15 minutes for someone to come to our table.  When the waitress arrived she dumped her jug of water on my wife, an instead of cleaning it up, she stood there for a minute with a "embarrassed" look on her face. We changed tables and told her "not to worry about it".  She didn't come back for along time so we left. Grabbed a margarita on the way out from the bar which sucked. There is way too many great casual Vegas restaurants to even bother giving them another shot.
Good food & great rock & roll music.   Fun place.

I've been to a few of their locations (including the original in Cabo) and I must say I like this one the best. We came here on a Wednesday night, so it wasn't as packed inside as it was outside on the balcony (facing the strip). The decor is awesome and the staff was great on this particular night. 

     Eric was our server, and he didn't waste anytime coming over to ask us what we would like for drinks. My friend and I ordered their bucket special which was any (5) Dos Equis or Heineken for $21. For food I ordered their delicious Baja style grilled fish (mahi-mahi) tacos. The fish tacos are not like the carne asada tacos as far as their size. The carne asada tacos are on a "street taco" sized tortilla while the fish tacos are on a regular sized tortilla. They are a mouth full and come with all the delicious fixings (cabbage, chipotle cream, and pico de gallo). Careful when you bite into them as they will drip onto the table, clothes, and eventually on the floor lol. I didn't notice it, until I was into my third and final taco. 

   Some of you might say we got great service because we came on a weekday when it was slow, but I've been to many places and got crappy service while not being busy. Besides, this is Las Vegas, there is never an off night.
By far the best Mexican food we've ever had! Visiting from Texas. Food was amazing, flavorful, FRESH. You can not go wrong here.

Food was good and service was fast. Sitting out on the balcony is very loud so if you don't like loud I would sit inside. Otherwise this place is
Pretty cool!

--- Review from www.JerseyGirlinVegas.com ---

Several months ago we came across a groupon for a restaurant on the strip in Planet Hollywood called Cabo Wabo. It's a Mexican/Cantina type of restaurant with some great dining options.

As we approached my birthday, my boyfriend asked where I wanted to have my birthday dinner. Without hesitation I said," Cabo Wabo!"  Lucky for us, they have another Groupon going for $15 for $30 worth of food and drinks!

Last time we went we shared a 3-Choice Fajita. It's a bit pricy for $45 but it is well worth it! Both times we selected the sirloin, chicken and shrimp. Both times they were fantastic!! There is the perfect amount of food for two people where you leave full and satisfied. 

During our first visit I went with a margarita on the rocks which was soooo yummy!! This time we went with the buck of beer, 5/ $21. It was a bit frustrating when we walked in to the hostess and they have a little bar with a sign for $5 beers but when you go inside to dine, they bump those same beers up to $6-7 each. Not that it's much of a difference, it's more of the principal. I guess they try to get the tourist as they leave the resort with the $5 beer? 

Moral of this post: Eat at Cabo Wabo's but get your beer at their bar near the host area.

I cannot say this clearly enough, DO NOT GO! We wasted $86 on this place. Took over 20 minutes to just get our chips and salsa. Chicken Fajitas and Pork Carnitas were bland and tasteless. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, I am a lightweight, I had almost 3 glasses and never felt a thing. My husband used to bartend and seriously doubted ANY tequila was in there, the overwhelming flavor was sweet and sour. No dissing the waitress as she attempted her best with no help from front door staff or bus staff. Yes it was a busy Saturday night but did they not expect that? C'mon already it's the strip! The only part that made us feel any better was the view of the Bellagio water show. Come sit at the bar overlooking it and have water!
Great place to people watch!  The service just absolutely sucks.  Takes forever to get food and drink.  But if you can sit outside on the patio you can people watch and it's a great view.  Very cool.

I bought a groupon for this place because I figured I could just get some drinks with it. We got there and told the hostess we just wanted to drink so she pointed us in the direction of the outside bar...well there were no seats in the bar, so we wandered around and eventually sat ourselves at the inside bar. The BF and I got a couple of their 'signature' margaritas. They were pretty terrible. I had the prickly pear margarita and it was very strong and tasted fairly terrible. Also, they put some super spicy stuff around the rim of the cup that was really unpleasant and was not mentioned on the menu. The drinks were 12$. This was ridiculous. I would not come back here again.

Came here for a quick frozen margarita, which was okay, not too icy slush. They offer different flavors. Unfortunately I don't remember the names of the flavors but thinking about their bar all I can remember was blue, green , yellow, red, and black margaritas from the dispenser pump. 

I'm not too much of a margarita guy but hey they serve these at different hotels , it just so that those colors of margaritas are tempting for a nice cool inject of alky for the mood. 

Service here was good, the bartender was pleasant, sucked that typically they tell you for extra shots cost an extra few bucks (hook it up?) Overall for a quick margarita to go, this place is recommended if you happen to walk down Planet Hollywood for some re-charging.

Three stars for the great service.  The  waiter was awesome. He was on top of things and offered many options and specials. 
The food on the other hand wasn't that great. My beans were runny and I think there was one actual bean included in the watery bean stuff.  The rice was fluffy but not very tasty. My asada was dry but had some good flavors. 

The churros were pretty good. 
The facility was very clean but a little run down considering it is on the strip where everything is glamorous.
Went there for breakfast and the food was AMAZING! So many options, very affordable and great service.

First time trying this place, been coming out here year after year and never took the time to come in, and that's a big mistake, definitely a must try, came in for breakfast, had chilaquiles and the quesadilla, both were BOMB ! And packed with flavor, will be returning here, also had very good service, nice host, and our server Amber was very helpful and made great recommendations. Thank You Guys !!!

Wonderful food.  We sat on the patio under the heated umbrellas and with the cool night air, laughed the night away.  We had the duo ceviche appetizer and LOVED IT!  The tuna was my favorite.  For dinner, I had the short rib tacos!  Phenomenal!  They are served like tapas (which the menu did not describe very well) on little corn tortillas.  So if you're really hungry you may want to add another appetizer. It was perfect for me since having just had the ceviche.  We highly recommend this place.
Terrible service and way too loud music. Waited for refills way longer than I should have. Waitress wasn't polite. The good news is that I got a free drink when I checked in on yelp:)

Ehhhh, I don't even know where to start. 

We were seated quickly on a Friday night which was great. The first thing I waiter did was pull an old waiter tip trick -- putting coaster under a "wiggly" table. The table wasn't even slightly off kilter. Whatever. I asked for water and Dr. Pepper to drink. He brought waters for everyone and 2 sodas and 2 beers. While we were looking over the menu we had questions. My mom and I don't eat beef or seafood, and their menu is very heavy with both of those things. We asked the waiter if we could switch the meat in the beef tacos to chicken. The answer was no. We asked if we could have chicken tacos in hard shells instead of soft corn. The answer was no. We finally settled on chicken taquitos which is technically an appetizer, but the only thing on the menu we MIGHT eat. It didn't come with anything so we both added beans and rice. My brother got some kind of beef taco in a soft corn tortilla and his friend got some kind of beef burrito. When they brought out the food, I had 4 taquitos on my plate, and my mom only had 3, so she asked, and they brought her another one. I ate exactly ONE taquito. The chicken inside was tough and bland. The rice was tasteless as were the beans. 

The waiter brought our check and it was $100 for four dinners, two of which weren't even eaten. We ended up boxing it up and giving it to a homeless man on the strip. 

Don't expect chips and salsa either. That's an extra $3.95, where I come from chips and salsa is always complimentary. 

Honestly, we had a hole in wall down the street that was SOOOO much better. 

Our waiter was rude, never once smiled, and seemed legitimately agitated. 

My brother and his friend liked it, so if you eat beef or shrimp, you might too, but if you are chicken eater like me and mom I wouldn't recommend this place.

We made a reservation on Open Table for this place. It was convenient. I found the seats quite uncomfortable. The food was okay. I had the chicken Sabana. I didn't love it, but it was interesting. The chips ans salsa were pretty good.  Service was very good.

don't get so excited - it's not the world's next Mexican food revelation. The location is prime, especially for those of us who love to people watch, and the staff is quick with a drink or pitcher refill. The food is good, though it doesn't blow me away - it is a chain, after all. The biggest draw to the CWC location is definitely just that - the location. Seating may get a bit tough if you come at a peak time, so be prepared to wait or walk elsewhere. I enjoyed the guac and the tacos, though the price didn't quite reflect the quality. If you're passing by and can catch a happy hour I would certainly recommend stopping by for an icy, salted beverage and some apps. Don't go out of your way though if you're looking for a place with some true authentic lip smacking mexican - Vegas has lots of it, but this isn't one of them.

Below average service, decent food. THE WAITRESS ADDED AN EXTRA $10.50 to her tip! This is the biggest let down. If the service was decent a 20-25% tip is a nice thank you but when the service is poor close to an 18% tip is generous when there was very little interaction. My wife and I had a $51.96 check, tip rounded the amount to $60 and the charge to our card posted $70.50! The tip was for the service, the food was only decent and so how the waitress earned a 35% tip is outrageous! Apparently she didn't realize I don't drink and rounding the check is an easy way for me to keep track of the amounts. I will be placing a call to speak to the management as well. We satay the table next to the bar and the kitchen. This was on 6/17/2017 during lunch. It posted to my account as a service on 6/18/2017 which is Sunday Father's Day and we were on our 
----------------------UPDATED----------------------After speaking to the Manager Jason I feel the service has been rectified. When management is proactive in acknowledging poor service it speaks volumes for any company or restaurant. Now to clarify my review of the food being decent, the carne asada tacos were enjoyed by all as well as the queso dip. My son-in-law really enjoyed the BBQ wings, and for me they had a little too much BBQ sauce, but for BBQ lovers you'll obviously enjoy them. The taquitos where the also split, my daughter really liked them, but she was the only one. So that would have to be the weakest item. Overall food was enjoyable at a fair price. After speaking with management I know we will return. 
R. Ishida

The margaritas (on the rocks) are excellent! Their coconut margarita is fabulous! The atmosphere is great and they play good (classic rock) music. The food is just okay but then again, I'm not a fan of Tex-mex anyway! If you are looking for a place to relax with friends and have a few tasty margaritas, this is the place to come! Oh, as far as the service, I only delt With the bartenders and they were fine.

Got the basic breakfast burrito..loved it. Perfect size and very reasonably priced. I will definitely revisit this place in the future... maybe tonight. The only reason didn't give 5 stars is that there was a small amount of construction going on inside the restaurant.
We went for breakfast, it was really good!!! I had chilaquiles and my wife had a veggie omelet, it was great!!! The waitress was awesome!!!!

I was expecting a much better experience from Cabo Wabo, but it was just OK. 

The food was the worst part of it. I thought it was meh, and my girlfriend didn't even finish her food. 

I had the Carne Asada Burrito served Enchilada Style. I was not a fan of the flavors. 

My girlfriend had the Chicken Enchiladas. She was not OK with them at all. There was so much Cilantro in the sauce and even more cilantro mixed in with the chicken it was extremely over powering. 

But what saved a 1 star rating was the service and the drinks. The drinks were awesome.
I had the key lime martini because I love key lime pie. Its really tasty. It is rimmed with graham cracker crumbs and it tastes like a kicked up key lime pie. 
She had a Margarita which she really liked. 

Overall I guess I just had a meh experience because of the food. I would probably give it another try, but try different food.

I will start out by saying that the food was good. Not great but it was above average. We had the shrimp ceviche and chicken fajitas. The ceviche was on point and we loved it. The chicken in the fajitas was very dry but still the fajitas were tasty enough. 

The day we went, the place was maybe 1/3 full. We were seated after waiting 4-5 minutes while the hostess made small talk with some ladies who weren't sure if they wanted to eat there. Meanwhile another hostess/employee stared into the abyss twirling her hair.  Once we were seated, we were told that our server would be with us soon. After 10-15 minutes of no server, we got up and sat at the bar because we were really hungry.  The bartender was very friendly but clearly new. She took our order and after a half hour, the food had not arrived. After about 35-40 minutes, the food arrived. Again, the place was in no way busy.  As we left, we saw a couple sitting at what was originally our table and I overheard them telling a waiter which they flagged down that they had been waiting for 15 minutes and not seen a server.

I love CABo 
GO FOR THE HAPPY HOUR 
its from 3pm-6pm 
Sit inside, me and my friends sat outside and I was dying. 
SOO HOTT !!!

HAPPY HOUR MENU 
Chilli Con 
All the nachos (LARGE & VERY GOOD) 
guacamole
quesdilla 
margarita, pina colda, and strawberry daiquiri were $5 dollars which were too small too me for $5 dollars and didnt have enough alcohol in them
Good service & cold beer. I would recommend drinking here and eating elsewhere.

This is definitely the best Mexican I have ever been to. The food amazing, chips and Queso with beef steak added to die for!
Also we had steak fajitas GREAT
Eat here and you won't be disappointed .
Great atmosphere with a little rustic charm added.
Great service from Kate, thank you. we will be back.

Excellent location off of the strip! Must sit on the patio! Faces the strip, outstanding atmosphere! Live music, GREAT food! Outstanding ribs, sweet and spicy chicken wings and best of all...the MARGARITAS!! The entrance is in he Miracle Mall! GREAT Mall by the way!

As a tourist in Vegas, this is a very touristy spot to visit while on the strip. Located in planet hollywood, you can't miss the restaurant right in front. We came for lunch and sat inside. The outside was more packed than the inside, but the Vegas dry heat is not our friend. The inside is extremely spacious with plenty of tables, and a photographer came by to take our picture as a souvenir while we waited for our food. They end up giving you the picture printed for free, plus 20% off discount on your next visit! The servers and hostess were accommodating and they never left us alone for more than 5 minutes. I might be exaggerating a little, but it seemed that way. Now the tacos, they were too spicy for my taste. I should have ordered what my boyfriend got, but I don't like ordering the same dish twice. I could barely finish them since the spice was too heavy, but if they weren't too spicy, I would have definitely finished every last bite. It's a memorable place because we have a picture souvenir, but definitely not somewhere where we'd go again. Even if we lived in Vegas.
I love this place. Good food, good music, AWESOME service from Betsy. I hate Vegas but I love this place

I was not impressed with the food!  It is not authentic Mexican food, which they don't necessarily advertise authentic Mexican food, but the salsa alone was disgusting, so I didn't touch my chips and salsa.  Their rice is gross as it tastes like paper.  Their beans tasted like can.  The chicken enchiladas were edible though, I did eat those.  The frozen strawberry was super yummy!  I think it bearly had alcohol though.

What are these people complaining about?  Didn't they arrive blasted drunk?  This place was great!  Sure the hot female staff in daisy dukes advertised turned out to be a prissy dude in jeans, but that wasn't too bad since the female waitresses tended to have a muffin top.  The drinks weren't good and overpriced, but with a few good drinks and several okay ones before you get here, who cares?  I ordered the mahi mahi. It's all right that it arrived rubbery and tough, because I just sent it back and got the short ribs with spit tacos instead. Given enough alcohol, the blandly seasoned meat won't matter as you revel in the extra grease that was such an integral part of the dish. If you're planning on being blind drunk in the area and are looking for a place with a bathroom, this is an easy half star better than peeing in the street!

This is my first and last experience here. The service was slow to begin with but when the waitress came it was fine. I had a dinner salad that had so much vinaigrette it was inedible.  The short rib enchiladas was ok, the meat was good but the tortillas were so tough a knife wouldn't cut it.  Thank goodness I played the slots and this meal was paid by the winnings.  I guess it was better then losing the 40. at the slots.  But I may have more fun playing the slots then I had eating the food.  Once was more then enough.

We wanted to visit this restaurant because Sammy's "Cabo Wabo" tequila was a sponsor for a stunt plane we loved seeing at the airshows and we are loyal to folks who sponsor the sport we love. So while we were at CinemaCon this year we stopped in for dinner. We were very disappointed. I would have given it 3 stars for food. 1 star for service. To start with it was not busy, We were seated under a heat lamp on a rather warm night and had to move, I felt like I was getting a sun burn. Unfortunately no one came to check on us for some time. We almost walked out but right then we found a table not under a heat lamp and the bus boy helped us move to that table. Finally we met our waitress, she was very rude right off the bat. "what do you want to drink?", I told her I was hoping to see a drink menu. I was informed they were out. "If you come back next week you can see one." Yes she really said that. WOW! So I just got a boring margarita. Turns out it tasted like almost every other margarita I ever had. I had been feeling festive and wanted to try something new but oh well.  At this point we changed our plans and decided just to have our first drink and finish our dinner and find someplace else to have a few fun drinks and desert. Too bad because we had permission to use the company credit card for a night out. Cabo Wabo could have made more than a few bucks off of us sucker tourists. Haha. Well, When the waitress would condescend to stop by, she never once smiled. Made me feel like we were bothering her by coming in. Food was pretty good. I was just shocked at the attitude of the waitstaff we encountered. Also on a side note, I slipped on spilled ice when going to the restroom (womans restroom was a mess). The employees did not even help me up, a couple customers did. Luckily I was not hurt just turns out high heels and ice dont mix well, but the girl working inside, who was about 20 feet away when I fell,  could have asked me if I was okay nor did anyone seem concerned there was ice on the floor.

If I had to sum up our visit in one word: BUMMER

The chips were okay, queso was not tasty definitely one of the worse. I ordered the carne asada tacos...definitely over cooked, the rice seems like it came out of a rice-a-roni box if I am being truthful. It definitely had a chain feel and not a good chain. The atmosphere was okay except sitting outside and a breeze hits...reminds me of the hot stagnant smells of New Orleans streets the morning after a mardi gras parade (warm regurgitated alcohol and urine)....take caution in dining and don't expect great food and you won't be disappointed....ps the service was great, very attentive waitress...
Epic. These guy BROUGHT US A TABLE. We just sat in the middle of nowhere on some chairs and they BROUGHT THE TABLE.  Quality. The margs are great too.
Spent an early evening there last night. Great bar staff x3 and one man band. Live music was awesomely entertaining which went with the personal touch of the staff and tequila!

I don't really know why this place has so many poor reviews.  My friends and I ate lunch here and we thought the food, drinks and the service were all pretty good.  I'd definitely eat here again if staying near the city center area on the strip.

We got our breakfast to go and I wish we had stayed to really enjoy the meal. I had the CW Skillet and my husband had the Huevos Rancheros, and both were AWESOME. The CW potatoes are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside ... some of the most "home fries"-style potatoes I've ever had. My scrambled eggs were perfectly cooked and my husband said his Huevos were the best he's ever had (and this dish is a go-to for him). Would have loved to stay and enjoy a morning bevvie with my food, but I was also very happy to learn they did take-out orders so I could get my hangover back to bed

I wasn't sure what to review this place. If it's for atmosphere I'd give it 5 stars. People watching on the strip was a blast. We sat at the counter seating overlooking the Bellagio fountain show. It was awesome! Our hosts and server were also excellent! However, I had to knock it down to 3 stars for the food. My boyfriend and I both disliked our meals. I am a mexican food lover so I just couldn't be happy with the food here. I would definitely come back just for drinks and thr view though!
YUM! Came here twice during our stay in Vegas. Service is great! Food is even greater! Highly recommend the ribs (yumm) and the piña colada as a drink :)

Yummy fajitas, but not so yummy Sunday night karaoke.

Skip it and sit outside if you can.  The entertainment is much better!

Who went there a couple days ago we had Ryan for our server
He did a really good job friendly explain all the plates .
Great recommendation for dessert.
The sound it wasn't that good that's why it taking a start.
It seems like it was a live band but we do not see it there was some video music from the 80's old school but Mary had to listen to that music in general it's a pretty good place for tourists I want to the blue moon for us.

I enjoy the food, drinks and atmosphere of this restaurant.  My husband LOVES their spicy steak (makes him cry every time) and I love their shrimp tacos (so light and delicious)!  Their margarita's are very yummy, my favorite is the one with coconut and honey on the rim.  Great place to eat!  Also, I love how the waitresses dress!
Located right on the strip. Horrible mixed drinks and expensive food. The service was not good. Our server was wearing a hoodie and called me "bro" ....i am not a bro.

I am a texmex junkie! I could eat it everyday. Cabo Wabo was a pretty good experience and here is why : 

1. The nachos were very good. Also the chips and dips were good also.
2. I ordered the beef tacos with rice. My food was good and large in portion size. Not the best I've had but okay.
3. Our waitress was cranky at first but warmed up. 

Would go there for happy hour

Service was fabulous here, our server was super friendly and attentive. The food was delicious and our group of 11 was happy with where we landed, especially after the poor experience we had at the first restaurant we tried that night. o.O The food was delicious and the place was PACKED. In reality it is in a great spot so of course there is going to be a lot of foot traffic. They made room for our large group and were very accommodating, our starving group was appreciative!

straight to the bar....order the 'flight of tequilas'. that's how my visits start! great drinks. great food. great music. great vibe. great service. gets crowded, so keep that in mind when planning your visit. the fajitas are to die for!

Loved the food....drinks were advertised as  hearty & were weak as allllll get out.  And, they added a 5%  franchise fee  to the bill.  Seriously a 4-5 star until that.  Asked the wait person, who got defensive (want a manager to explain it to you?).  Always, great food held back by cheesy pass on of 5% franchise fee to the patrons.  Recommend you drink elsewhere.  Food very yummy.

A nice place to rest your feet after walking the strip and have a nice refreshing drink. I came down to vegas for my best friend's wedding and me and my friend decided to do the tourist thing and walk the strip. We decided to head there since the live band called to just. Friendly bartenders and we got to meet a nice older couple. Defenite recommendation

The inside of the place looked like a glorified Taco Bell, I was really disappointed with the layout and feel of the place since it is a celeb owned restaurant. The nachos were terrible and made my husband sick, but I got the Carne asada tacos and they were really good and I was fine later. We also had tons of food we wouldn't normally eat and drank a lot more than usual. (I think it finally caught up with him and made his stomach hurt) I ordered guacamole and chips as a side and it was SO good. I wasn't able to eat even half  of it, but I wish we had one close by just so I could get the guacamole.

The empty bar should have been the first clue to the mediocrity that is Cabo Wabo.

The food was ehhh ("tostada" was more a pile of oversauced food on a nacho)... The service was ehhh... The music was slightly too loud... And the karaoke (which consisted of two creepy, old male singers and no crowd) was pretty awful.  Quite saddening.

I only can here to drink  had a pitcher of margarita it was pretty good I could definitely taste the alcohol in it can't tell you what the food was like but it was pretty packed so it must have been decent

We stopped in before a concert. The food was okay. It felt like they squeezed us in at our table. Waiters kept walking into us and the table. The food took quite some time to come out. We didn't get everything so we had to keep asking. The food tasted good. The whole experience wasn't great so it lowered the experience. The four stars is for the food. I wouldn't come back.

This is a really great beer stop on the strip. Specials on buckets of beer and chill spot to hang with friends. Great view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain. The only down side is service is kinda slow and you might have to hunt them down.

This is a place I've been wanting to hit for a while. NYE was super crowded but was able to return for my birthday trip. Dining in for a quick snack on a weekday, the vibe at this place was awesome, they had a cover band (which I didn't catch their name) covered a mix of alt music and rock, it was absolutely chill as if it were a Sunday afternoon. The nacho platter was delicious, cheese blend covered perfectly and had the right amount of sour cream and guac. The weather was perfect. I high recommend this place to sit back enjoy great food with great company. The staff was so attentive and great, came in with beer from the casino and offered to refill, they all were on point. Wait time was zero and fit us in super quick. Definite repeat customer here. Great job. Can't wait to return for UFC on the weekends!

Had the dos ceviches, the shrimp was almost as good as mine.  The tuna was a little oily, but the flavor was good.  Drink prices are good and my margarita was good.  Atmosphere was busy and loud, but fun!

Of all the places we are at during our recent trip to Las Vegas, our random stop into Cabo Wabo Cantina was our favorite of the trip

The atmosphere, we sat outside was top notch. The view was excellent and service was very prompt and attentive. 

We had the Cabo wabo margarita and now jealous we can't have one back home. Best drink we had during our stay! 

We shared fajitas and we chose the chicken and carnitas mix. That didn't let us down either. We saw the next table over had the Mexican corn and we are now food jealous. 

We were expecting the price to be outrageous because of location along and again we were surprised. 

We will definitely go back when in town.

My experience at Cabo Wabo was Awesome!!! 

The hostess was friendly, the location and view was perfect (right on the strip),  the food was delicious (FYI... I had the shrimp enchiladas) and my waiter Danny M. was INCREDIBLE! He knew the menu like the back of his hand and was friendly and engaging. Definitely recommend! Ask for Danny M!

Went to Cabo Wabo because we were in town for a bachelor party and one of the groomsmen was feeling a need for some mojitos. I was skeptical at first because I figured these guys focus their efforts hocking 3' tall slushy drinks on the miracle mile. I was wrong.
We sat at the bar and ordered a round of mojitos. Before I knew it we were 2 mojitos down and the bartenders started pouring shots of fireball on the house while grilling us on our favorite nfl teams. It was basically nfl trivia; get a question right, get a shot, get a question wrong, get shot with a water pistol (I got shot a lot). We laughed with these guys for a solid hour while drinking some of the best mojitos I've ever had and laughing about sports.
If you get the chance to sit down at Cabo Wabo I highly recommend sitting at the bar because these guys know how to have a good time.

We came here about 2 years ago. I'm mostly to blame. Being a Van Halen fan I wanted to eat at Sammy hagar's place....not a bad place to eat at all. In fact we had fun at our seats which overlooked the strip and had a view of the ballagio's fountains. But the food was just "ok" I had a burrito (I've had better) and my girlfriend had the street tacos....maybe we're California Mexican food snobs, but this was definitely some white washed Mexican food. Still edible but I guess go for the experience.

This place was horrible! Went in for dinner, place was about half full, if that... Should have been a warning sign... Took more than 20 minutes to get a drink order in. Over 30 minutes to get some chips. Chips came, and the server had dropped off a load of beer for another table at the same time as getting out chips. He had manages to get the run off from the beer all over the chips. Didn't notice it till we were like wonder why the wet!?! Gross! Food came about 45 minutes later, it was nasty... Dry, flavor-less, and my stomach was all messed up after this place. Wonder why... 

Save your money, don't go here. Everything from the food to the service is a joke...

Go here for a Rita and watch the Bellagio fountain.

Even it's a bit cool you can sit on the patio above the sidewalk and enjoy the view and do some people watching and stay warm with the patio heaters.

You will find the food and service is average at best. 

A Cabo Wabo Anejo rita will set you back $14 and served in a plastic cup.
Stopped in to cool off... Nachos are awesome.  We wanted to compare it (restaurant) to the cabo wabo in cabo, Mexico.  Totally different but good none the less.  I highly recommend this place!

We stayed in Vegas for 4 days and came here 4 times. It was hands down my favourite casual dining spot on the strip. The happy hour menu is best as it is half price apps and margaritas. Also good for brunch and also good for drinks. The patio is the best. Great atmosphere and live music at night and it was an incredibly reasonable price. This place felt like a home base restaurant while we were in Vegas. 
Food was great for the price and the atmosphere can't be beat, right in the middle of the action.
The wait staff is ok. They are inconsistent And one waitress was great and another was slow etc. It did take a long time for the food to come but ...hey, we were on vacation and had nothing better to do but sip our drinks. Loved this place. Bottom line... Highly recommend.

Are you looking for the best sugar water in town you found it!!!! Better go to Fat Tuesdays!!!! Better deal!!!. I got the 18 dollar drink wit supposedly 4 1/2 shots it tasted nothing but like sugar water I will not recommend this to anyone avoid this place at all cost! I even asked if she put the extra shot she said yea but you will taste it!! Nope I didn't
The beef and chicken tacos are excellent. Make sure you check in and you will get a free margarita!!
